loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 67 años de edad , es viuda y madre de tres hijos quienes ya son mayores y tienen su propia familia, su corazón es muy grande ya que por ahora tiene a su cargo un niño de 11 años a quien cuida porque su familia lo abandonó; ella vive en una casa propia a lado de su madre y el niño a quien esta cuidando.El trabajo de Norma consiste principalmente en la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, pone a la venta diferentes artículos como talcos, cremas corporales, perfumes entre otros. Realiza este trabajo por más de 20 años. Trabaja sola ya que no necesita de la ayuda de otra persona para hacer su labor porque ya se acostumbró a su rutina y tiene sus métodos para facilitar su trabajo y hacerlo con mayor rapidez. Eventualmente se dedica a trabajar como costurera.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su propio tiempo, además de tener la facilidad de realizar las actividades de su hogar brindando el cuidado necesario a los miembros de su familia. Le esta yendo bien en todo y tiene buenos ingresos gracias al esfuerzo que hace en colocar sus productos a personas responsables y solventes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 2000, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos .Con el monto solicitado comprará más cosméticos y productos de belleza para tener en stock y ofrecer a sus buenos clientes.
texts.en:
Norma, 67, is a widow and has three adult children who have their own families.  She has a very big heart as is caring for an 11-year-old boy whose family abandoned him.  She lives in her own home with her mother and the child in her care.  

Norma's work consists mainly of selling beauty products by catalogue.  She sells different articles, such as talcum powder, body lotions, perfumes, etc., and has been in business for over 20 years.  She is sued to working alone because she has her own routine and methods to facilitate her job, making it quicker.  Sometimes she even works as a seamstress.

What she enjoys most about her work is that she can schedule her own time and have the ease of doing her house work and taking care of the members of her family.  Everything is going well for her, and she has a good income, thanks to her efforts in selling products to responsible people who can pay on time.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN and is grateful to everyone for helping her continue toward her goal.  She will use the loan to buy cosmetics and beauty products to have on hand to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris, de 33 años, es una mujer amable y muy alegre, convive con Jorge quien es el padre de sus 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad respectivamente, todos ellos viven felices en su casa propia compartiendo el mismo deseo por alcanzar el progreso.Iris se dedica a brindar solución a los problemas mecánicos y eléctricos de los vehículos de transporte como mototaxis y motos. Tiene un taller de mecánica que administra desde hace 3 años, está ubicado en su casa en una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad y ahí llegan a diario muchos transportistas en busca la solución para sus vehiculos. Trabaja con ayuda de un técnico automotriz o de su esposo quienes realizan los arreglos necesarios para culminar su labor con mayor rapidez. Empezó a trabajar cuando vio la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico estable para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.Le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes habituales que también se encargan de recomendarlos por la excelente labor que realizan en su establecimiento, ahora quiere vender repuestos vehiculares con el objetivo de brindar una nueva opción a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1500 para comprar repuestos de motos y mototaxis tales como rodajes, cámara de llanta, telescopio, aros y faros para realizar su trabajo y al mismo tiempo para ofrecerlos en venta al público ademas agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Iris, 33, is a kind, cheerful woman who lives with Jorge and their two children, ages 7 and 10.  They all live happily in their own home, sharing the same desire to get ahead.  Iris does mechanical and electrical repair for transport vehicles such as motortaxis and motorcycles.  She has a workshop that she has been running for three years out of her house, located on one of the main avenues of the city.  Every day she is visited by many transport workers who need to repair their vehicles.

She works with the help of an auto mechanic or her husband, who make the necessary repairs to speed up her work.  She started the business when realized she needed a stable income to give her children a better quality of life.  Business is going well and she has several permanent customers who also recommend her services because of the good work she does at her shop.

Now, she wants to sell spare parts in order to give her customers a new option.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy motorcycle and motortaxi spare parts, such as tires, telescopes, hoops and light bulbs.  These will be used in her work but also sold to the public as individual parts.  She is grateful for the financial support to continue her work, and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycles and motortaxis.

loans.name: Angelo Fabian

texts.es: El Sr. Ángelo  tiene 23 años es soltero, se dedica al servicio de internet y juegos en red en su café internet que tiene en la populosa zona de Villa Victoria de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el es cliente nuevo, el Sr. Ángelo  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de repuestos para computadoras y compra de un televisor para los juegos ya que este es también uno de sus servicios,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la compra de este material, el Sr. Ángelo  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existen varios café internet, pero el no se puede quejar ya que tiene clientela y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas equipos de computación para equipar mas su negocio, el Sr. Ángelo  estudia en la universidad, cuando su tiempo lo permite, el es una persona muy trabajadora esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene,  se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Angelo is 23 years old. He is single. He is dedicated to internet service and MMO games (online multiplayer games) in the internet café that he has in the populous area of Villa Victoria in the city of La Paz. This loan is his first with the institution. He is a new client. Angelo is going to use this loan to buy parts for computers and to purchase a television for the games since this is also one of his services. His reason for requesting this loan is that he does not have enough money to buy these materials. Angelo faces challenges in his business which are competition since in his area there are various internet cafes. But he cannot complain since he has customers and he will use the proceeds to buy more computer equipment to equip his business more. Angelo studies at university when his time permits. He is a very hard working person. This is the only activity that he performs. He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity provided to him.

loans.use: to buy parts for computers and to buy a 32-inch television.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 61 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad e independientes, tiene su casa propia en donde vive junto a una de sus hijas y sus dos nietos, juntos comparten el mismo deseo por salir adelante.El trabajo de Sofía consiste en la costura y confección de diferentes prendas de vestir que le solicitan sus clientes. Refacciona prendas que necesitan enmendar y además crea prendas exclusivas de acuerdo a la actividad que u ocasión a la que asistirán sus clientes. Realiza este trabajo en su casa en donde tiene una maquina de coser de gran utilidad. Lleva más de 40 años realizando esta actividad y con el paso de los años su experiencia y la calidad en su trabajo han mejorado.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite hacer algo que le emociona, además tiene tiempo libre para poder descansar y hacer otras cosas en su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1000 soles, se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio , por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro.Con el monto solicitado comprará telas, hilos, botones, agujas y elásticos para continuar trabajando como costurera.
texts.en:
Sofía, 61, is single and has three adult, independent children.  She lives in her own home with one of her daughters and two grandchildren, who all share the same desire to get ahead.

Sofía works as a seamstress and makes different kinds of clothing, depending on customer orders.  She also makes alternations and creates exclusive designs depending on the activity or occasion.   At home, which is where she works, she has a good sewing machine.  For over 40 years she has been involved in this activity and the quality of her work has improved over the years will all of her experience.

What she enjoys about her work is being able to do something she loves, while also having free time to relax and do other things around the house.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN; and is happy about having access to a line of credit to advance in her work.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time so she can continue in the future.  She will use the loan to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, needles and elastic to use in her work as a seamstress.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Toribia Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Toribia sigue con la misma actividad de la carpintería,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para la compra de madera y una cepilladora, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de material de construcción ya que esta haciendo realidad la construcción de sus vivienda se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Toribia continues with the same activity of carpentry. She says that her last loan went well since she used it to buy wood and a planer. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy construction material since she is actually doing the construction of her house. She feels happy and thankful for the opportunity given to her to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction material.

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es: Eldith, de 52 años de edad , es madre soltera y cuido sola a sus tres hijos, ahora tiene a sus hijos mayores y son independientes, ella tiene una casa propia el cual comparte al lado de sus dos hijos y la familia de uno de ellos.El trabajo de Eldith consiste en la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, su especialidad son las colonias y perfumes, ella sale a la calle en busca de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares para vender algún producto o entregar aquellos que ya han sido solicitados con anticipación. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años aproximadamente y lo hace sola ya que ella ahora sola solventa sus gastos y sus hijos la apoyan ocasionalmente. Eventualmente vende comida los fines de semana ya que vive cerca de un parque deportivo y eso le permite tener una clientela fluida durante esos días. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder descansar y estar en su casa haciendo sus actividades, le esta yendo bien ya que no genera muchos gastos y lo que vende le alcanza para pagar los gastos básicos que requiere.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.3000, es por ello que agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito financiero que le permita concretar sus planes.Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos para tener en stock como perfumes, talcos y cremas corporales,cosméticos , entre otros .
texts.en: Eldith, 52 years old, is a single mother and alone took care of her three children. Now her children are older and are independent. She owns her own house which she shares with her two sons and the family of one of them. Eldith's job consists of selling catalog cosmetics. Her specialty is colognes and perfumes. She goes out onto the street in search of her friends, neighbors and family members to sell some products or to deliver those things that have already been ordered in advance. She has been performing this work for approximately ten years and she does it alone since she now only pays her expenses and her children support her occasionally. Eventually she sells food on weekends since she lives close to a sports park and this allows her to have a constant flow of customers during those days. What she likes about her work is that it gives her time to be able to rest and to be in her house doing her work. It's going well since she does not generate a lot of expenses and what she sells covers the basic expenses. At this time she will request S. 3000. It is for this that she is thankful to all the people who provide the opportunity to access a loan that allows her to nail down her plans. With the amount requested, she will buy more products to have in stock, like perfumes, powders, body creams, cosmetics, among other items.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, powders, cosmetics, among other things.

loans.name: Luchadoras De Los Chajones Group

texts.es:
DUO LUCHADORAS DE LOS CHAJONES
Este dúo lo forman doña Oralia de los Ángeles, quien nos cuenta que es casada, tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando en párvulos y es dueña de una tienda ubicada cerca de su casa donde vende artículos de consumo diario y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestible de consumo diario ya que nececita mas mercaderia para surtir su tienda, ya que sus clientes han aumentado y le piden variedad de mercaderia, espera que le puedan apoyar con el credito solicitado asi ella pueda salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Luchadoras de Los Chajones Duo

Mrs. Oralia de los Ángeles is a member of this duo. She is married and has a child that goes to kindergarten. Oralia owns a store close to where she lives, where she sells essential items. She is requesting a loan to buy staple food supplies to stock her store, since her customer base has grown and is asking for a wider assortment. Oralia hopes to receive the loan in order to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy staple food supplies for her store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra.  Rosario, sigue con la actividad de confección de prendas de vestir, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de tela, la Sra.  Rosario va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de telas  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes
texts.en: Mrs. Rosario continues tailoring garments. She says that the previous loan was useful for her and she used it to buy fabrics. With this loan, Mrs. Rosario will buy varied fabrics in order to have a wider variety of products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics.

loans.name: Wend La Malgda Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNA représente le groupe WEND LA  MALGDA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. 05 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des céréales  depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de KILWIN. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 04 sacs de 100kg de maïs.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Mme ambitionne agrandir son commerce, s’occuper de sa famille et s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Mamouna is the Wend La Malgda group representative. She is doing very well. A married woman, she is the mother of 7 children. The eldest is 28 years old and the youngest, 11. Five of her children go to school and she is responsible for 5 people.

Mamouna has been selling cereal for 11 years. She gets her supplies at the Kilwin market. Her customers are men and women. She wants to buy 4 100-kilogram bags of maize. She would like to save her profits. She aims to expand her business, take care of her family and buy herself a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy 4 x 100-kilo bags of maize.

loans.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en:
Javzanpagma is a 36-year-old hardworking and very trusted repeat Kiva client. She lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver in a private company, having worked for a public transportation company for nine years. Javzanpagma has a 7-year-old son who goes to kindergarten and a 16-year-old daughter in secondary school. 

Javzanpagma started her business in 2004 by selling building materials at Tsaiz, Mongolia's biggest raw materials outdoor market, with a working capital of 2,000,000 MNT. In 2007, she bought a semiautomatic cutting machine for 3,000,000 MNT to produce firewood. Javzanpagma buys raw materials from the wood truck which comes from the countryside and sells the firewood. As a result of her hard work, she now has working capital of 8,500,000 MNT.
 
Spring is the high shopping season in Mongolia for the wood-selling business, so Javzanpagma is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy more wood.

loans.use: to purchase wood for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Al-Twkl Ala Allah Group

texts.en:
Al-Twkl Ala Allah is a group that consists of four ladies who live in Dhamar, Yemen. They are women who work hard in order to increase their income. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER.
Anisa is a 26-year-old single woman who lives in poor conditions. She hopes to improve her living conditions. She says she does not have enough money to buy what she needs. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use in her house.

loans.name: Wend Goudoum Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZARATA représente le groupe WENDGOUDOUM. Elle se porte bien. Sur la photo, elle est habillée en rouge avec des dessins jaunes et tiens un plat dans lequel il ya du couscous de manioc et du poisson. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 04 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration (vente d’haricot) depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les grande boutiques de Bissighin et au marché de Kilwin. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 04sachets d’attiéké (couscous de manioc), 01sac de riz et  01sac d’haricot.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  épargner. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son commerce et scolariser ses enfants dans de meilleurs écoles.
texts.en:
Zarata is the Wendgoudoum group representative. She is doing well. She is the woman wearing the red dress with the yellow design in the picture, and she is holding a dish of cassava couscous and fish. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The eldest is 13 years old and the youngest, 5. All of her children go to school.

Zarata has been running a restaurant (and selling beans) for 9 years. She gets her supplies in the large shops in Bissighin and at the Kilwin market. Her customers are men and women. She would like to 4 sachets of attiéké (cassava couscous), 1 bag of rice and 1 bag of beans. She wants to save her profits. She aims to expand her business and to ensure that her children get an education at the best schools.

loans.use: to buy 4 sachets of attiéké (cassava couscous), 1 bag of rice and 1 bag of beans.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en: Gad is 25 years old. He is married with a businesswoman but they haven’t had any children. He sells various items in his shop and has been in the business for two years. He wants this loan to buy more items such as rice, beans, and sugar to sell. He wants to renovate his house with the profits.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en: Zoljargal, 32, lives with his wife, two children and mother in law in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. In 2007, he went to Korea on an employment contract and after working for two years he came back to Mongolia. He began rendering taxi service to Korean people in Ulaanbaatar, usually picking his customers up from the airport, their hotels or Korean-invested companies. The automobile he uses for his taxi service has deteriorated over the years and he gave it to his brother. He is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to purchase a natural gas vehicle. The natural gas vehicle has cleaner emissions and less fuel waste than diesel and gasoline engines. Cleaner emissions means that purchasing of natural gas vehicle will contribute to efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better life.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her husband's agriculture business.

loans.name: Saima Group

texts.en:
Saima is 32 years old and a hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband, two daughters, and a son. Her husband is a government employee, but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Both of her children are studying in government schools.

Saima is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2006, she has been operating her own beauty salon. Currently, the beauty stock of the salon is almost finished. Therefore, Saima wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. For that, as a member of a 2-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colours, and some other variety of products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. With the profits, she will pay the installments of the loan and school fees for her children.

She dreams of living a happy, healthy, and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for her beauty parlour.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is 30 years old. He is married with three children. He sells drinks, andazi (fried dough), and other merchandise in his boutique, which he has been running for five years.

He has requested the loan to buy more drinks to sell, such as mineral waters and sodas. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Irene has been working hard to manage her business, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize flour, rice, and beans to sell, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay some of the school fees and school needs for her children. 

Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Irene, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is from Kapan town. Together with her husband, she runs a store where they are trading clothing. 

Shoghik's daughter, Nona, studies at Yerevan State University in the department of international relations. A few months ago, Shoghik applied for a loan to cover her daughter's educational costs for the first semester. Now, with a good credit history behind her, to pay for her daughter's education Shoghik has applied to SEF International for another loan. With the help of the loan, she will pay her daughter's university tuition for the second semester. The loan will help Shoghik to give Nona an opportunity to get higher education and become a good specialist.

Shoghik dreams of seeing her children educated and useful for society.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition for the second semester.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a hardworking woman with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She deals in produce and specifically sells groundnuts. She also practices subsistence farming and sometimes sells the surplus, depending on the season. Price fluctuation and limited capital affect her business profits while her dream is to own a food store. 

Annet intends to use the loan to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 40-year-old man from Migori Town; he supports five people in his family, He is married to Mary who is a businesswoman and also provides little support for the family, he has four children who are 16, 13, eight and six years old.

He sells fish in the town market, and he has been in this business for the last eight years and makes a monthly income of KES. 8,000. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more fish for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into his business. He has hopes of becoming a successful businessman and also supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy  more fish for sale

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 28-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Since 2001 her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central market. Rabia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. 

With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Sahr Mathew's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from a primary school in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 7,000,000 SLL for the entire team. With the help of this loan, these teachers can meet their immediate financial challenges and at the end of each month, they can make their loan payments using their monthly salaries.

Komba is the featured leader of this group. He is a native of the village of Canaan, near Kono. The 40-year-old is married to a teacher and the couple has six children. 

Komba has been a school teacher for 28 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay the school fees for his children. He will also use part of the loan to buy house-building materials such as iron, corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi is a 46-year-old, hardworking woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a mobile technician who runs his own shop. 

Rubi is a very experienced and skilled woman. She has sold bed sheets and clothes for the past five years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a variety of bed sheets and clothes from other cities at lower rates and then sell them for a profit. 

She lives in a rented house but she wants to build her own house. This loan could fulfill her dreams and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with three school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and her children's school fees.

Asha has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past five years. She sells fish to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of purchasing fish, especially when cold currents affect the deep sea. 

Asha is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Siaba

texts.en:
Siaba is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. She cites school fees and the cost of transportation as her highest expenses.

Siaba has operated a beauty salon business for the past three months. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics for resale and an air conditioner for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale and an air conditioner for her shop.

loans.name: Marus

texts.en:
Marus was born and lives in Ijevan city with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. She graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical College and has for many years worked in one of the kindergartens in Ijevan city as nursery-governess. Those years she always remembers with a smile, as she loves children very much.

 But Marus fell on very hard times; her lovely husband died and she couldn't support her family needs alone, as the salary at the kindergarten was not sufficient, so she started to run her own business. She imports men's and women's clothes from overseas wholesale centers and sells them in her own store in Ijevan city. With the profit from her clothes trading she provides part of her family needs. Another part is provided by her son, who now works in the Russian Federation.  

Marus needs a loan to buy, from Yerevan wholesale markets, a new assortment of spring-summer seasonal men's and women's clothes for reselling.

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of spring-summer  men’s and women's clothes

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Yerevan, Armenia, with her mother. She is 19 years old and studies at Yerevan State University in the economics department. 

Svetlana's mother works at a local company and does her best to pay for their daily costs. However, unfortunately her salary is hardly enough to cover the family's basic needs, so it is very difficult for her to save money for Svetlana's education.

Svetlana has requested this loan in order to pay for her university tuition. The loan is very important for Svetlana to complete her education and become a skilled economist.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Nham

texts.en:
Nham was born in 1963. She has three children who are adults. Her husband is a farmer who earns about 2,000,000 VND per month. 

Nham sells cooked foods and groceries to earn a living. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 19 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, Nham would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy canned foods, noodles and snacks to sell in her grocery store. Her dreams are to organize weddings for her children and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy canned foods, noodles and snacks to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Kimya Group

texts.fr: Odia est présidente du groupe d’affaire Kimya, entrepreneur et mère de 3 enfants. Son conjoint est commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons. Elle s’installe au marche centrale de Virunga. Elle commença cette affaire vers les années 1999 avec son fonds propre. L'insécurité sur la route est un défi pour son activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 5 sacs de poissons salés.  Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.il ya deux clients de sur plus sur la photo du groupe.
texts.en:
Odia is the leader of the Kimya business group. She is an entrepreneur and the mother of 3 children. Her spouse is a retailer of miscellaneous items. Odia sells fish. She displays her products at the Virunga Central Market. She started her business around 1999 using her own funds. One of the challenges she faces in her business is the insecurity on the road. This new loan will be used to buy 5 bags of salted fish. She would like to ensure that her children get an education. Finally, Odia would like to thank Hekima strongly for its support in microloans.

Note: there are 2 extra customers in the group picture.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of salted fish.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 31 years old and lives in the town of Arua1 in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his small business, which is selling clothes. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help him to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business so as to create more job opportunities in town. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with three children, some of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Sajida Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a 45-year-old hardworking woman from Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a mobile technician and runs his own shop. 

Sajida previously worked in a clinic, but after getting married she left the job, and for the past ten years she has been running a one-room shop in her house where she sells clothes after purchasing them from different cities. 

At the start, she faced many problems in her new business, but now she is a successful businesswoman. Sajida's husband is very caring, and he helps her in purchasing clothes from different cities. Now she is interested in buying more clothes to sell, so that she can offer a variety of clothing to her clients. 

As a member of a two-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the profit, she is planning to extend her business by opening a new shop in a market. She wants to make some savings for her children as well. She desires to provide quality education to her children and dreams of their bright future. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva. 

Note: In the picture Sajida is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase new variety of cloth

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanakombo sells cooked food from home to the general public. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase foodstuffs like maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs, like maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is coming to Yehu for another Kiva loan of 50,000 KES. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is grateful for the opportunity that Yehu and Kiva have given her.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Msaada

texts.en:
She has been operating a Khanga (women's wraps) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

She is coming for another Kiva loan. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in the business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of reeds and a tin of dye for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of reeds and a tin of dye for her business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 36-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has eight children and her husband is working as a carpenter. The monthly income of her husband is insufficient to meet their household expenses due to the large family size, therefore Naseem is helping her husband by doing her own business. She has been successfully running her business of selling ornamental items for 8 years.  

Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She would purchase a large quantity and new variety of bangles, bracelets, necklaces, key chains and other ornamental items and sell them for a profit. This could increase her sales, monthly income and savings and she could support her family in better way. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bracelets, bangles, necklaces, etc

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a twenty-nine-year-old ambitious man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has a retail shop where he sells general merchandise and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Like most traders he is faced with hardships of price fluctuation and inadequate capital while his dream is to own a depot and a wholesale shop. Wilson intends to use the loan to buy crates of beer, sodas and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, sodas and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Patora

texts.en: Pastora is 62 years old. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old and separated. She has 3 children. Pastora operates her own retail business to earn a living. Her income from her business is about 5,000 PHP each month. She has been in her business for 11 years. She joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In the future, Pastora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Omina

texts.en:
Omina is divorced and has a child who is small. She always wanted to provide him with good living conditions, and since her husband doesn’t help her with money to provide her child with a good quality of life, Omina decided to start a new business in animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can manage her home’s finances. 

She has been busy with growing vegetables but her income is small.  She studied a course through a women's organization called ‘To Get Ahead’, and got enough skills about business. Her mother will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting her new business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She has been in this business of selling fresh fruits and vegetables for the last four years earning a monthly income of  38,000 KES.

Irene is requestng her second loan from KADET for 50,000 KES, which she will use to add more stock to expand her work stall. With the anticipated profit, she will educate her children and add more stock. Her future plans are to complete her rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase assorted fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
She has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors. In addition she also operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business which earns her another source of income. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, fuel for her motorcycle and pay maintenance costs. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, fuel for her motorcycle and pay maintenance costs.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a 23-year-old from Yerevan. He lives with his mother and studies at Yerevan Mesrop Mashtots University in the loyal department. Together with his studies, Karen works at local cafes in order to sustain his and his mother's living expenses. But unfortunately, his salary doesn't allow him to save money for his education, so Karen has requested this loan to pay for his university tuition. 

It is very important for Karen to be able to complete his education, become a good specialist, find a well-paid job and ensure a better life for his mother.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Kulsumbai

texts.en:
Kulsambi operates a food stall and a retail shop where she sells household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Her major business challenge is the delayed payments of her creditors. Kulsambi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Kulsambi is requesting a loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: “PAZ Y BIEN”  es uno de los grupos puntuales en sus cuotas ellos se encuentran pasando el ciclo 12 cada uno de los integrantes se dedica a actividades diversas del comercio. Jennifer tiene 30 años 2 hijos menores  es conviviente. Hace dos años y medio tiene su negocio de bazar con la ayuda de su pareja. Años atrás trabajaba en el quiosco del colegio donde estudia su hija. Su mayor deseo es agrandar su negocio. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de peluches, collares, aretes, etc. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Jennifer es la cuarta persona del lado izquierdo viste polo negro.
texts.en:
Paz y Bien is one of the groups that is punctual with their payments.  They are in their 12th cycle.  Each one of the members works at diverse commercial activities.

Jennifer, age 30, is in a common-law marriage and has two minor children.  She has had her household goods business, with the help of her life partner, for two and a half years.  Years ago she worked at a school kiosk where her daughter went to school.  Her biggest wish is to expand her business.

She will use the loan to buy stuffed animals, necklaces, and earrings, etc.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Jennifer is the fourth person from the left, and she is wearing a black top.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, necklaces, and earrings, etc.

loans.name: Cabrita

texts.en:
Cabrita is 33 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past eight years, Cabrita has been a farmer who plants, harvests, and sells coconuts. She earns 10,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2010.

Cabrita is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to pay for labor to make copra. She hopes and dreams of having a better future and improving her living situation.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs to make copra

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 47 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past seven years, Adelina has been a farmer who plants, harvests, and sells coconuts. She earns 3,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2010.

Adelina is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes and dreams of improving her business and living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is 28 years old and is married with a child. He lives in the town of Arual in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past six years, Sunday has been working hard to manage his small clothing business. 

Sunday is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes to sell to help expand his business. His loan will help him generate greater profits that he will use to improve his family's living standard. In the future, Sunday hopes that he will be able to own a very big boutique in town. 

Sunday is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sunday who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Sarah plants and harvests corn to earn a living, which she has been doing for 24 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. 

Sarah is requesting a loan from GDMPC for 15,000.00 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2004, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Sarah wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of selling palm leaves for house roofing. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of palm leaves for resale. She joined Yehu to acquire loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Marilinda Irene

texts.es: La Sra. Irene tiene 50 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Conzata, y también  entrega sus almuerzos a distintos negocios y tiendas,   La Sra. Irene una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La Sra. Irene les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como abarrotes y aceite por mayor, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal, el deseo de La Sra. Irene es poder tener un puesto fijo ya que esto le haría crecer más en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene, 50, sells food in a stall located in Conzata. She also delivers lunches to different offices and stores. Irene is a hardworking person that step by step, and thanks to her commitment, has reached financial stability and solvency. She has also become popular with customers because she offers them a kind service.

With the loan, Irene will buy different ingredients in bulk to prepare food. She says that it is possible to grow more by working hard and in that way assure better life conditions for her and her family. Mrs. Irene would like to have an establishment, something that would help her expand her business and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk to prepare food.

loans.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora is 45 years old and widowed with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over six years, Procora has owned and operated a fishing and fish-vending business. She earns 15,000 PHP every month and joined GDMPC in 2010.

Procora is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan to purchase fishing materials, such as nets and hooks. She hopes and dreams of having a better future and improving her living situation and business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets and hooks

loans.name: Dúo Rositas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Rositas de san Bartolo
Este dúo está integrado por doña Shirley Janette, ella tiene 33 años de edad y tiene dos hijos varones, ella se dedica a la venta de frijoles volteados ,y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de producto por catalogo,  en el mercado local de san Bartolo y distribuye frijoles en las tiendas locales de  san Bartolo, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su negocio , principalmente para compra de frijol en grano por quintal, leña y una licuadora ya que la que tiene se le arruino, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado para que ella pueda seguir con su negocio y asi aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Shirley Janette is a member of this duo.  She is 33 years old, and she has two sons.  She sells refried beans.  As a secondary business activity she sells products by catalog at the local market in San Bartolo.  She distributes beans in the local stores in San Bartolo.

She is requesting the loan to invest in her business.  She will primarily buy dried beans by the ‘quintal’ [1 quintal = 100 kg], firewood, and a blender.  The one that she has is ruined.  

She hopes that you can help her with the requested loan so that she will be able to continue with her business.  This way she will increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy dried beans by the ‘quintal’ [1 quintal = 100 kg], firewood, and a blender.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 26-year-old married woman who is the mother of one child. She works in a beauty salon to help her husband make a living. Rana is a hard worker who is recommended by most of her customers. She dreams of opening her own beauty salon instead of working for others, but her financial situation doesn't let her make her dream come true. Rana also uses her car to visit her own customers in their homes to provide requested salon services. She needs transportation to continue to provide her mobile beauty services.

Rana is requesting a youth loan through the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to maintain her car until she's able to buy a new one. This will be Rana's second loan cycle from Al Majmoua. She used her previous loan to purchase materials needed to support her mobile beauty business.

loans.use: to maintain her car

loans.name: Jorge Leonardo

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge tiene 24 años, el se dedica al servicio técnico electrónico desde hace tres años,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Jorge  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de herramientas y materiales que le permitan realizar un buen trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es el poder contar con las herramientas necesarias para estar preparado cuando le llamen o lleven algún trabajo a su tienda El Sr. Jorge  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que muchas personas al igual que él se dedican al servicio técnico, el va a utilizar los beneficios compra de mas herramientas para su trabajo, El Sr. Jorge  se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es su principal fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, 24, has worked for three years as an electronics technician.  This is Jorge's second loan sequence with the institution.  He's going to use it to buy tools and materials that allow him to do a good job.

He's requesting this loan to be able to have the tools he needs to be prepared when he gets a call or when someone brings a job to his store.

The challenge Jorge faces in his business is competition, because a lot of people work in technical service as he does.  He's going to use his profits to buy more tools.

Jorge's happy about being offered this opportunity because it's his main source of income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 34 years old. She is from Yerevan and lives with her brother. Gayane works at one of the local companies as an accountant. She is also studying for her master's degree at the International Scientific-Educational Center of the National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Armenia. Gayane is studying in the department of pedagogy and sociology. Together with her brother, she works hard to cover their daily expenses. It is very difficult for them to save additional money to cover their educational costs. 

Gayane is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition. It is very important for her to get her master's degree, find better job, and improve her and her brother's life.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Meyoki

texts.en:
Meyoki is 49 years old married to Jane. The couple is blessed with eight children. For the last six years, Meyoki has been a mixed farmer. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Meyoki is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase cows, sheep, and goats. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to boost his business by expanding to buy more cattle. In the future, Meyoki  hopes and dreams of enlarging his business for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cows, sheep, and goats

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 26-year-old single woman who has worked as a hairdresser from her house since 2008. Her business is going on just fine and she covers almost all of her needs and some of her family's too. Most of Mariam's customers are friends, relatives, and neighbors. She intends to expand her business by moving from her home to a separate beauty salon when she becomes financially capable of managing this step forward.

Mariam is requesting a youth loan through the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new furniture for her house salon. She plans to please her customers with this slight decoration and hopes of saving money to expand and move out in the future.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her house salon

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is 40 years old and married to Alice. The couple has been blessed with a child. For the past seven years, Rodgers has run a cereal shop and he earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Rodgers is requesting a 70,000 KES loan to purchase more stock of assorted cereals. This will be his fifth loan and he has successfully paid his previous loans. Rodgers plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to add more stock of cereals

loans.name: Simba Group

texts.en:
Florida is in her late 30s, married, and has one child who attends school.  She runs two businesses, selling clothes door to door and selling charcoal.  She works from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

Florida is requesting her 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling charcoal and increase her clothes stock.  She used the profit to add one room on her small house, pay school fees, and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.  Her dream is to add another room on her house.

Florida will share with loan with her loan group Simba, consisting of 12 members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gisela Paola

texts.es: La Sra. Gisela tiene 35 años,  casada  tiene tres hijos de las edades de 3, 11 y 12 años, se dedica  a la confección de prendas, tejidos y bordados de manteles para mesas de comedor, hace ya muchos años,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio  que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Chasquipampa, este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Gisela va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de sus productos y tambien de lana para el tejido de bufandas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión, la Sra. Gisela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de manteles  de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes, la Sra. Gisela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Gisela, 35, is married and has three children, ages 3, 11, and 12.  For many years she has earned a living making clothing, knitting, and embroidering dining-room tablecloths.  Her workshop is in her house, located in the Chasquipampa area.

This loan is Gisela's second sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy fabric to make her products and also wool to knit scarves.  She's requesting the loan to increase her investment capital.

The challenge Gisela faces in her business is increasing her income.  She's going to use her profits to invest in materials to make high-quality tablecloths so she gets more orders from customers.

Gisela's a very hardworking person.  She's happy about the support offered and grateful to the institution because this is the only job that allows her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy wool and rolls of fabric

loans.name: Handomah

texts.en: Handomah is a 19-year-old single woman who opened an accessories shop three years ago to make her living and to support her family after her father passed away. Handomah likes and enjoys her business a lot, and is working hard to improve it. Unfortunately, she does not have the financial ability to  develop it widely. She is rarely able to add new products to cater to diverse customer needs. Handomah is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy newly released accessories collections. She is very excited about this loan because she is sure that through it she will be able to add new products and designs that will attract customers' attention and increase her income. She is working hard on expanding her business more in the future by moving to a bigger place.

loans.use: to buy newly released accessories collections.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a new client who is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete his rental houses so that he can increase the rental income he earns. With this income he will pay tuition for his children and meet his family's other needs, and in the future he will build more rental houses to help support his family. He is hard working and excited about the partnership with UGAFODE and hopes to grow with it.

loans.use: to buy building materials for completing houses.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona is from Yerevan. She studies at Yerevan State Linguistic University of Armenia. She lives with her mother and elder sister who work hard to sustain the family's living. Unfortunately their monthly income is hardly enough for covering the family's living costs and it is very difficult for them to save money for Sona's education. Sona has requested this loan to pay for her university tuition. This loan is very important for her to be able to complete her education, get higher education and become a specialist. Sona dreams of finding a well paid job and helping her mother with the family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 34 years old and her children are in school. She is happy that her tailoring business is better after her previous loan as she was able to buy a sewing machine and more materials that helped her meet the demands of her customers. She is now applying for her second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable to her buy more material to make outfits for her clients. She hopes to be able to own a plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 29 years old, from Nyandarua South, and is married, with four children who are in school.

Irene has a farming business that she has been doing for the past five years and she has applied for her fourth loan to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizer to use on her farm. She hopes to boost her farming business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 29-year-old married woman who works hard to help her husband in making their living. She has been selling Brazilian gold for a year. Her business is mobile: she visits customers to market her products. 

Zeinab is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to start a new clothes selling business so as to earn an additional income. She loves her business a lot and she enjoys communicating with people. Zeinab is sure that she will enjoy her new business once it is established. She hopes to open her own shop one day and host her customers in a very professional way.

loans.use: to start a business of selling clothes.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 29 years old and lives in the town of Koboko, in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Peace has been working hard to manage her retail shop, in which she sells soap, sugar, milk, and bread. 

To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize, rice, sugar, and soap to sell and will help Peace to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Peace hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up another retail shop. 

Peace is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Peace, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, rice, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baskets, flour, cheese, chicharron, beans, cabbage, vinegar, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 34-year-old lady from Kisumu county. She is married to Peter, a business man, and has three children who are 12, 11 and seven years old respectively.

Florence has a retail shop, a business she has been running for the last 14 years, and makes a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more items for her shop, like maize flour, cooking fat and salt. She will use the anticipated profit to pay the school fees of her children and construct new rental houses.

She has a dream of becoming a successful entrepreneur and also of supporting her children to receive a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more salt, cooking fat and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Laura Lilian

texts.es:
La señora Laura es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo,sus  3 hijos  y  4 nietos en una comunidad de Choluteca al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   producción  de  granos  básicos  desde hace más de 30 años. 
Doña Laura con el préstamo espera comprar 1 batería, televisor y 6  focos, con esta inversión espera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, al poder realizar más actividades por la noche  y tambien sus hijos podrán  estudiar en horas nocturnas  y recrearse con programas  educativos.
Doña Laura en unos años espera que su vida y situación  económica mejore un poco y seguir  apoyando   a  su familia  para que se  conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en:
Laura is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. She lives with her husband, 3 children and 4 grandchildren in the community of Choluteca in southern Honduras. She has worked in the production of basic grains for more than 30 years.
Laura hopes to buy 1 battery, a television and 6 lamps with her loan.  She hopes to improve the quality of life of her family and herself, by being able to do more activities at night.  Also, her children will be able to study at night and enjoy educational programming.  Laura anticipates that in a few years her life and economic situation will improve a little and she will continue to support her family so they can become good people with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras  –  March 2013

loans.use: to buy one battery, 1 television and 6 lamps for her house

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 55 years old, lives in Nyahururu, Kenya, and is the married mother of one school-age child.

Jane is a farmer who grows and sells cereals. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to buy more stocks of maize, beans and rice to sell. She hopes to see her business expand so that she can open up a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and rice

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 35 years old and married to Francis, who is a businessman and contributes to the family income. They have three children, ages 3, 8 and 10 years old. Teresia has been running her business for four years with an income of about KES 25,840 a month.

She is taking a second loan after successfully repaying the previous one which increased her profits and improved her family's living standard. She wants to use the loan to add more stock of green vegetables, fruits and cereals. She hopes to expand her business and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to add more stock of green vegetables, fruits and cereals.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 28-year-old single man who has been working in planting and harvesting tobacco for 15 years. He earns income from the government buying his production every year and he is working on increasing it. Husein also opened a convenience store to generate extra income.
Husein is a hard worker, well known in the region with a good reputation.
Husein is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to start a new business. He will buy a power generator and provide people with electricity since the government, for now, has no solution for this major lack.
He hopes to keep on increasing his businesses in professional way and managing them equally.

loans.use: To start a new business providing people with electricity.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
Pauline is 35 years old, a widow and has four children who all attend school. Despite the fact that she earns little income, Pauline has managed to provide all the necessities for her family.
Pauline deals in the sales of charcoal and she has been in business since 2007 when her husband passed away. Ever since the death of her husband, Pauline become a very hardworking lady since no one would offer her help in bringing up her children. She has managed to provide the best for them through hard work.
Pauline believes in conservation of her environment and she does numerous activities like planting trees in her compound. She requires a loan to complete her sewage system which would help her in maintaining hygiene in her home and the neighborhood.
Pauline, as leader of Vision Group, therefore humbly requests the lenders to help her complete her sewage tank to maintain her environment so that she could keep it safe from diseases likely to break out due to poor waste disposal.

loans.use: To complete a sewage tank system.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Ms Shahida is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is trying hard to satisfy her family's needs, which include food, health care, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been farmers for many years, raising different types of fruits and vegetables which they sell in a local market. Her son helps her grow these crops by watering the soil to ensure a high-quality crop. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. In order to buy different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Shahida is requesting a loan of Rs. 10,000. This would help her to grow more crops and ultimately generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy different types of seeds, along with insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Estrellas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Thomas, tiene 64 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá, junto con su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Don Thomas, es una persona dedicada desde pequeño a la agricultura y es su única fuente de ingresos. El cultiva papas, frijol, maíz, tomate y otros, y le dedica todo el tiempo necesario. El préstamo que solicita es en forma grupal pero el solicita 7,000.00 Lempiras siendo este el  tercero y es para comprar semilla de papa, abono y pago de mano de obra para la siembra de papa y frijol. Los préstamos le ayudan a mejorar la producción dándole buena asistencia a sus cultivos. Su plan de seguir mejorando la producción y mejorar también su calidad de vida mediante las ganancias obtenidas. 
El es el presidente del grupo solidario al cual pertenece llamado Estrellas unidas, que está formado por 8 integrantes que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura, de los cuales solo siete están solicitando otro préstamo. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta doña María con vestido azul, seguido esta Santos con camisa gris, Felipe con camisa manga larga cuadriculada, Juliana con vestido verde, Tomas con camisa cuadriculada por dentro  y Ruperta  a  la derecha con vestido estampado color anaranjado y amarillo y Martin no salió en la foto. El préstamo total del grupo es por 34,500 lempiras. Todos van a invertir en el cultivo de papa y frijol.
texts.en:
Thomas is 64 years old and lives in a village in the Intibucá municipality with his wife and their five children.  Thomas has worked in agriculture since he was young and it is his only source of income.  He grows potatoes, beans, corn, tomatoes, and other crops and works whatever time is necessary.  

This loan for 7,000 lempiras is his third with the group.  He plans to use the loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and pay laborers for the potato and bean harvest.  Loans help improve his production by giving him good help with his crops.  His plan is to continue improving production and also improve his quality of life with the income he earns.

He is the president of the community bank he belongs to called Estrellas Unidas, which is made up of eight members who live in the same community and work in agriculture.  Of the group, only seven are requesting this loan.  

In the photo, they are identified as follows: on the left, María is dressed in blue, followed by Santos in a gray shirt, Felipe in a long sleeved plaid shirt, Juliana in a green dress, Thomas in a plaid shirt, and Ruperta on the right in an orange and yellow print dress.  Martin is not in the photo.  

The total loan for the group is for 34,500 lempiras.  They are all going to invest in potato and bean crops.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and pay laborers for the potato and bean harvest.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past three years, Solomon has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Solomon has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts to sell, and will help Solomon to generate greater profits. This will help him take care of his parents with basic needs and pay for the medical bills. Solomon hopes that in the future he will be able to start selling motorcycles. 

Solomon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Solomon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell,

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a 31-year-old retail shop and salon owner in Bamburi Mombasa. She is a proud mother of two and her husband provides additional income. She has been in these businesses for the last five years and has done well.

This marks her first loan from KADET LTD, to purchase dry food stock including tea leaves and sugar, and cosmetics for her salon. 

With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business. She hopes to meet the expectations of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dry food stock, including tea leaves and sugar, and cosmetics  for her  salon

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
Don Jose tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos y reside en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Don Jose tiene un taller de reparacion de maquinaria y equipo pesado. Este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años con el proposito de crecer mas economicamente, el es muy conocido por el servicio que brinda de buena calidad y tiene bastante demanda de clientes.Don Jose ha solicitado varios creditos con Odef los cuales le han ayudado mucho a mantenerlo activo. Actualmente solicita el sexto de 17000 lempiras el cual invertira en comprar herramientas que necesita para el desempeño de su trabajo como, llaves ajustables y de cruz, empaques, aceites, grasas etc.Con esta inversion solventara la demanda de trabajo en su negocio. los planes que tiene es hacer el taller  mas grande para poder darle a su familia bienestar economico.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Jose has a machinery and heavy equipment repair shop.  He started this business 15 years ago with the goal of growing financially.  He is very well known for his good quality service and he has enough customer demand.  

Jose has requesting various loan with Odef which have helped him stay active.  Currently he is requesting his sixth loan for 17000 lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of tools that he needs to do his work such as adjustable keys and cross keys, gaskets, oils, grease, and more.  This investment will resolve the demand in his business.  He plans to make the workshop larger to be able to give his family financial wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as adjustable and cross keys, gaskets, oils, grease, and other items to repair cars.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 37 years old and lives in Margibi county, the largest rubber producing region in Liberia. She is a married mother whose children are in school and aged between 9 and 13 years old. For six years now she has been selling bread, cakes and sweet-bread in a market. Her aunt taught her how to make these baked goods and her business is now popular and making more profit. Hawa is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter and oil. In the future, she plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her business, such as flour, sugar, butter and oil

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 25 years old and works as a charcoal dealer in the town of Voi, Kenya. He is single, supports his parents and has been in this business for three years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, and plans to use it to buy sacks of charcoal for his store. He will use the additional profits he expects to earn to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to be a great charcoal supplier in his town.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for his store.

loans.name: Wajibu Group

texts.en: Isaya is in his early 30s, married and the father of one son who is enrolled in a local school. For the last four years, he has earned a living by running a grocery store. He works from 5:00 am to 11:00 pm every day and makes a fair monthly profit. He is applying for his ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock missing items in his grocery store, buy several empty crates of sodas and beers and buy more chairs for his customers to use. He has paid back all these loans successfully and used the profits he earned to start building his house and to pay for household expenses. His dream is to one day become an international businessman. He will share this loan with his group, "WAJIBU," which has 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a new retail shop.

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en:
Abdel Karim is a 24-year-old single man who works providing maintenance for motorcycle generators and power generators. He is very experienced in his business, and he has gained customers' trust and support.

He is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary spare parts for his business. He will also finish building a small part of his house. The increase in business capital will automatically increase his income because he can get the necessary spare parts at a competitive price, which will widen his net income range. He hopes to keep on developing himself and his business at the same time to make sure he continues to serve his customers well.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts

loans.name: Obura

texts.en:
