His mother is the one who used to own the clothing business but two years ago, owing to her age, she decided to leave it to her son.  He is now in charge of running the business and he is doing very well.  He has a good customer base and uses the profits he makes to buy merchandise on a daily basis and cover his household expenses.  He is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes, scarves and tablecloths, which sell very easily, and skirts and blouses, which are very profitable.  In this way, he will be able to help his parents with their expenses, stock his business with more products and make better income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (shoes, clothes and tablecloths)

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface lives in Kwale county, in southern Kenya. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Bonface is married, and has six children. He has been farming for 25 years and is currently growing maize and mangoes on his land. He is excited to start beekeeping because the bees will help pollinate his crops, thereby increasing his production. He also likes the medicinal properties of honey and he hopes to use some of the honey produced by his hives for personal use. 

This is Bonface’s first loan and he will use the income generated from his beehives to pay his children’s school fees. In the future, Bonface hopes to start a tree plantation on his land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Empezó hace varios años con la venta de cosméticos luego comenzó a vender artículos pequeños para el hogar gracias a Dios le ha ido bien le gusta lo que hace.

Compra mercadería al por mayor y la vende con su esposo trabajan de  7h00 a 21h00. Venden artículos varios como tostadores, batidores y planchos. 

La dificultad que ella tiene en su negocio es el miedo a que le roben ya que hay muchos ladrones. Tambien su enfermedad ya que el es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida). Si  está casada su esposo a parte de la ayuda que le da vendiendo los articulos tambien es maestro electricista tiene un hijo de 9 años estudia en una escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo va a comprar artículos de cocina como tostadoras, batidoras, planchas etc. Su sueño es poder disfrutar junto  a su familia y poder tener un gran local  donde pueda vender más artículos y dar trabajo a más personas
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil.  She started out a number of years ago selling cosmetics, and later she started to sell small household items.  Thanks to God the business has done well, and she enjoys her work.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise at wholesale which she will sell with her husband.  They work from 7am until 9pm.  They sell a variety of items such as toasters, blenders and irons. 

One difficulty she faces with her business is the fear that she will be robbed, because there are a lot of thieves in her area.  Another challenge is her illness, because she is a patient living with HIV/AIDs.  She is married and her husband, in addition to helping with her sales, also works as a master electrician.  They have a son who is 9 years old and who attends a public school.

With this loan, she will buy kitchen appliances such as toasters, blenders, irons, etc.  Her dream is to be able to enjoy her family and to have a big store where she could sell more products and also give work to more people.

loans.use: to buy products such as toasters, blenders, irons, etc.

loans.name: Varujan

texts.en:
Varujan has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years. He keeps 2 cows, 70 lambs, 2 pigs, and 30 chickens. He also cultivates potatoes and sells the harvest in the local market. He runs his farm with great love and care and does his best to earn a high income and sustain his family.

Varujan lives in the village of Shirakamut with his wife and three sons. His elder son works abroad and helps the family financially, but unfortunately this is hardly enough to cover the family's basic needs. Accordingly, Varujan has requested this loan, which he will use to help him purchase 4 calves, barley to feed his livestock, and seeds for cultivation. The loan is very important for Varujan to expand his farm and ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase 4 calves, barley to feed livestock, and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Zion Shg Group

texts.en:
Zion SHG group is a newly formed group comprised of 14 (fourteen) members.  All the group members are engaged in different income-generating activities.  Hatneineng is one of the Zion SHG members and she is pictured with her hand raised. She says that her friend Pi Neilam also runs a garment stall in the same town market and she availed a loan from Kiva lenders. She was able to expand her garment business. She belongs to Janlai Lengnu group. One can check the group link here:  http://www.kiva.org/lend/484282 . Pi Neilam told her about the lenders on Kiva and how they were funded for their business. Therefore, Hatneineng decided to join a group with her other friends who are economically active. They formed the Zion SHG group and became a part of WSDS.
 
Hatneineng rents a place in the town market and she runs a garment-selling business. She has been in this business for more than three years. She is a competent and determined businesswoman. She always wanted to stand on her own feet and be successful in what she did.  Since she has been running the business for so long, she has a lot of customers who she values, so she tries her best to supply them with what they order. She also wanted to sell garments on credit but she could not facilitate her customers with that service because of her limited capital. She was not aware of the presence of Microfinance institute in the state and used to believe that taking loans would instead become a burden with the interest. 

With the Kiva loan, she hopes to expand her garment business and she is determined to pay back the loan on time. Hatneineng says that with the loan, she wishes to buy more garments for selling and gradually expand her business.  She wants to utilize the loan by purchasing different garments for all age groups and make a good profit. The rest of the group members are doing different businesses like a piggery, poultry, weaving, a tea stall and a dukan. Hatneineng thanks Kiva and the lenders for supporting her and helping to shape her business. She says, " Thank-You Kiva".

loans.use: To purchase more garments to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Maphombe, a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Joseph is married and has two children. Both he and his wife have been farming for 20 years and they are currently tending an orange orchard. Joseph is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because they have “very prompt service.” He is also interested in beekeeping because of the prospect of making his own honey, which he likes because of its medicinal benefits.

This is Joseph’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to repair his leaking roof. In the future, Joseph hopes to build himself a new home.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en: Upon returning from two years of service in the army, Marat found a means to make a living by opening a store. He rents a small shop in the city of Vanadzor. Marat has been running his business successfully for more than two years. Currently he is applying for a loan in order to purchase the goods (candies) for his store. This is very important for Marat to be able to meet his client's demands and stay competitive in the market. Marat lives with his mother and brother and does his best to ensure a better life for them.

loans.use: to purchase candy to sell in his store

loans.name: Kimanthi

texts.en:
Kimanthi lives in Maphombe, a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.

Kimanthi is married and has seven children. He has been farming for 65 years and is currently tending an orange orchard on his land. He likes Honey Care Africa because they give good advice on hive placement and ways to increase honey production. He likes beekeeping because it is a good project that will generate income.

This is Kimanthi’s first loan and he plans to save some of the income generated from his beehives to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Maingi

texts.en:
Maingi lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food from wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

Maingi is married and has twelve children. He has been farming for fifty-six years and is currently growing oranges and some passion fruit. He is very excited to start beekeeping because of the way that it complements his farming activities: bee pollination will increase the size of his passion fruit which will, in turn, result in higher earnings. 

This is Maingi’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to invest in equipment to help mechanize some of his farm’s operations. In the future, Maingi hopes to dig a well to help meet his domestic water needs.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Maphombe, a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Mary is married and has six children. Both she and her husband have been farming for fifteen years and they are currently growing maize on their land. She is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because their hives are well made and their hive technicians give great service. Mary is also looking forward to starting beekeeping because she enjoys eating honey. 

This is Mary’s first loan and she plans to use the income generated from her hives to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik has been involved in agriculture for 16 years. She keeps a cow and 15 chickens, cultivates tomatoes and grows peach, apple and pear trees. Hasmik works hard to gather a harvest and her husband Samvel takes it to a local market and sells it. Realizing that agriculture helps her to have a stable income, Hasmik wants to expand her agricultural activity.

She is taking this loan to purchase cucumber and tomato seeds and fertilizer and renovate the old greenhouse. This is very important for her to get an opportunity to cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables.

Hasmik lives with her husband and son and does her best to have appropriate living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cucumber and tomato seeds and fertilizer, and renovate the old greenhouse

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en una casa en anticrético junto a su madre, ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada en una entidad pública, por más de ocho horas al día ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, pasajes y pago de servicios básicos, es por eso que solicita el crédito para cubrir el pago de la universidad ya que está cursando el último año en la carrera de Derecho.
El sueño de Julia, es mejorar sus ingresos y terminar sus estudios para poder ayudar con los gastos a su madre y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Julia is single and does not have any children. She shares a single room in a house with her mother, which they rent pursuant to an anticretic contract.  

This house is located in the area of Miraflores in the city of La Paz.  

She is currently working as an office worker in the public sector for over eight hours per day and with her small income she must cover the costs of food, transport and basic services. For this reason she is asking for a loan, so that she can pay for university since she is in her final year of studying law.  

Julia's dream is to improve her income and finish her studies so that she can help with her mother's expenses and in this way improve her quality of life

This is the first time she has asked IMPRO and Kiva for a loan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of university in her final year of law school.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in Magodi, a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food from wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area but many farmers are very interested in owning hives.

Simon is married and has been farming for fifteen years. He is currently growing mangoes on his land and is excited to start beekeeping because honey sales will be another good source of income. He likes working with Honey Care Africa because they offer free training sessions and the chance to learn about beekeeping. 

This is Simon’s first loan and he plans to use some of the income generated from his hives to build an enclosure for his animals.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Mafisini, a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.

Joseph is unmarried and is currently growing mangoes on his land. One of the things that attracted Joseph to beekeeping was pollination: he is looking forward to increases in yields on his mangoes from the bees’ activity. He also likes working with Honey Care because he believes that their “program unites farmers.” 

This is Joseph’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to support local orphans. In the future, Joseph hopes to be able to raise income to support other social programs.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, who is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 29 years old, married, and the mother of one child. For three years now, Grace has been growing coconuts, earning PHP 5,000 a month. During harvests, she will produce copra and then sell it. The coconut shells will be used to make charcoal.

In 2011, Grace joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase farm supplies and seedlings. She plans to improve and expand her agricultural business and hopes to open a sari-sari store one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and seedlings.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en: Rovelyn is 34 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business making nipa huts in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 23,500 PHP to purchase raw materials for making a nipa hut. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making a nipa hut

loans.name: Kelita

texts.es: Kelita, tiene 56 años de edad esta casada y tuvo 2 hijos que ya son adultos ,actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo , sus nietos y su hija .El trabajo de Kelita consiste principalmente en el cultivo de plantas ornamentales. Tiene un espacio en su casa el cual lo ha destinado como jardín de siembra de diversas variedades de plantas utilizadas en decoración u ornamentación de jardines botánicos o viviendas. Cultiva rosales, margaritas, gardenias, calas, geranios entre otros, los cuales vende en pequeñas macetas. Lleva en este negocio más de 5 años y disfruta cumpliendo este rol. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es observar la belleza de las flores por la variedad y los colores vivos que tienen, espera seguir cultivando sus plantas y que sean más vigorosas.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 3500 soles para la compra de abono orgánico, semillas y plantones para aumentar el área de su jardín de cultivo,además agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en: Kelita is 56 years old and married. She has two children who are already adults. She currently lives with her husband, daughter and grandchildren in a house that she owns. Kelita's business consists mainly of growing ornamental plants. She has a space in her house that she uses as a garden for growing several varieties of plants that are used to decorate or embellish botanical gardens or houses. She grows roses, daisies, gardenias, calla lillies and geraniums, among other flowers, and she sells them in small pots. She has been in this business for over five years and she enjoys fulfilling this role. What she likes about her work is watching how beautiful the flowers are because of their variety and their vibrant colors. She hopes to continue growing her plants and to see them become stronger. On this occasion she'll ask for 3500 soles in order to purchase organic compost, seeds and seedlings so that she can expand her gardening area. In addition, she's thankful for the financial support she receives and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost, seeds and plants.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. She has seven children and has been doing this work for 16 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is 'feeding and milking dairy cows!'  Her biggest challenge is, "shortage of animal pasture during dry seasons and diseases". Animals on the farm have been given the names of  Maua and Samoo. She will use the loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Violet was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because it gives loans to farmers at a lower interest rate."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She replied, "They are short term loans given by microfinance institutions to farmers and businessmen."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Violet replied, "The income from the sale of milk will help me educate my children and expand my other businesses."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Violet owns cows and poultry but does not own pigs, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, and a sewing machine but does not have electricity, running water, TV or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 35 year old Aminata.  She is married and has three children aged 9, 12 and 15 years. She started her soft-drink business in 2003 to assist her husband in the home affairs. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are market shoppers. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 250,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires a loan in order to realize more profits and for her business to grow and expand. She hopes that this loan will support her to grow through proper use. In the future, Aminata plans to purchase a piece of land and erect a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks to re-sell.

loans.name: Yanice

texts.es: Yanice de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad y tienen 3 hijos en las edades de 15, 19 y 23 años. La meta de Yanice es aumentar su capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio temporada a temporada, y ganar más dinero, rotando todos sus inventarios. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará útiles escolares principalmente, que son los artículos de mayor salida en su mercado; ella tiene una importante experiencia en ventas que desarrolló hace muchos años, cuando vendió su negocio y decidió cambiarlo por una miscelánea que es mas coherente con su perfil personal y con la que se siente muy a gusto, porque en ella ofrece muchos articulos, de los que su clientela necesita, como ropa, bolsos, mercancia escolar  y articulos para su hogar. Su esquema de ventas es de contado y así mismo compra de manera permanente, pues ha logrado aplicar a 11 financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que le han permitido hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su infraestructura de mercado, mas adelante sueña con adecuar su local de manera confortable y poco a poco se prepara para ello.
texts.en:
Yanice is 46 years old and lives in a metropolitan area of the city of Malambo. She has three children aged 15, 19 and 23. Yanice's goal is to increase her working capital to stock her business from season to season, and to earn more money, rotating all of her inventory. This is why she went to ask for a CrediKiva loan, financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will buy school supplies, primarily, as they are the items that are sold at her market most often.

She gained important experience in sales many years ago, when she sold her business and decided to switch to selling miscellaneous products that are more coherent with her personal profile and what she loves. She offers many items that her clients need, like clothing, bags, school supplies and home goods.

Her sales plan is in cash and she likewise buys in a permanent manner. She has managed to apply for 11 loans with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which have allowed her to make her business grow and increase her market's infrastructure. Down the road she dreams about adapting her place comfortably and she is preparing for this little by little.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, primarily

loans.name: Naba Durga Group

texts.en:
In 2009, Naba Durga, a Joint Liability Group, was formed by fiver active and energetic women from Lachhipur village in the Nuapada district in Odisha, India with the objective of adding some extra income to their family by taking out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Mauna is one of them. The lady standing second from right with her hand raised is Mauna. She is 45 years of age and a very hardworking lady living with her husband, one son aged 24, and one daughter aged 20.who have, after finishing 10th standard schooling, been helping their parents.
 
Mauna has been running a dairy farm with five buffalos for the last 12 years. Her husband and son help her in nurturing the buffalos and the milk supply. The primary work of Mauna is to clean the buffalo shed every morning and keep the shed clean. Mauna gets 15 liters of milk daily and supplies it to a sweet stall in a nearby town. She gets payment from the stall owner on a weekly basis. Apart from the milk, she also extracts cheese, curd and ghee from the milk, which fetches extra income for her. Mauna earns a monthly net income of 6,000 Indian Rupees (INR) but it is not sufficient to manage her household expenses along with the fodder expenses for her buffalos. Therefore, to earn some extra income, Mauna has planned to utilize the present loan to purchase another two buffalos of an improved variety. Mauna has a dream of saving some money for the marriage of her daughter and son and  to construct a house. The other four members are Sabitri, Sudha, Puspanjali and Sudhansubala and they are have businesses like a dairy farm, a fancy store, and a general grocery shop, respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing two buffalos

loans.name: Diakalia

texts.fr:
Monsieur  DIAKALIA est âgé de 35 ans et vit avec son épouse dans la sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
DIAKALIA n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à la fabrication et à l’achat vente  et d’aliments volailles. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand éleveur et commerçant d’aliments volailles. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter des produits lui-permettant lui même de fabriquer l’aliment volaille et de le revend en détail à OUELESSEBOUGOU et village environnant  à crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
DIAKALIA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en: Mr.Diakalia is 35-years old and lives with his spouse in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou in the Koulikoro region of Mali.  Diakalia did not have the chance to attend school. At a very early age, he became interested in income-generating activities, especially the manufacture and sale of poultry feed.  He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who was once a rancher and merchant of poultry feed.  In order to satisfy his growing customer base, Diakalia decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso.  He is on his first individual loan that will enable him to buy the products necessary to manufacture himself poultry feed and to resell it retail in Ouelessebougou and neighboring villages for cash and credit to a mix of customers.  Diakalia hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan and the remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the manufacture of animal feed.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana, tiene 30 años de edad,es soltera pero es madre de 2 hijos pequeños a quienes cría con mucho amor, vive junto a ellos en la casa de sus padres y es ahí donde se esfuerza todos los días por darles lo mejor de sí misma para salir adelante. El trabajo de Diana, consiste en la venta de golosinas como galletas, caramelos, chicles y chupetines, generalmente lo hace de manera ambulatoria los fines de semana en la puerta de las discotecas o fiestas que se presentan en la ciudad , además de ello tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas ubicado en la casa de sus padres, ella es muy conocida por su buen humor y carisma, lo cual ha hecho que sus ventas le den los ingresos económicos que requiere ,lleva cerca de 5 años en ésta actividad auqnue al principio sentía que era muy tímida para realizar esta actividad con el tiempo pudo desarrollar sus cualidades y ahora vende mucho y está muy contenta por eso.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír, considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender bajo los fuertes rayos solares de la mañana, por eso le encantaría tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para ofrecer a sus clientes, como galletas, chicles, caramelos , entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Diana is 30 years old and single. She has two small children whom she raises with a lot of love. She lives with them in her parents' house, and she works hard everyday so that she'll give the best of herself in order to get ahead. Diana's business consists of selling snacks such as cookies, candy, bubble gum and lollipops. She usually makes traveling sales on weekends, in front of clubs or parties being held in town. Aside from that, she has a small stand located in her parents' house. She's very well-known because of her sense of humor and charisma, which has caused her sales to result in the profits she needs. She has been in this business for about five years, although at first she felt like she was too shy for this line of work. In time she was able to build up her qualities and now she sells a lot, which she's very happy about. What she enjoys the most about her work is talking to the customers and making them laugh. She believes that the hardest part is having to sell under the heavy morning sunlight. That's why she'd love to have a snack store where she could work more comfortably and offer her customers a wider variety of products. On this occasion she'll request 1000 soles. She's thankful to the people who provide the loan she needs to accomplish her plans. On the other hand, she pledges to make her repayments in a timely fashion.
With the requested amount she'll purchase a larger quantity of snacks to offer her customers, such as cookies, bubble gum and candy, among other merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase cookies and candy, among other items.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra de 35 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en el municipio de Soledad;  allí tienen su propio negocio, mediante el cual fabrica calzado y capacita en este arte. Entre sus líneas de productos están los bolsos, el calzado y la marroquinería en general. Su experiencia data de hace 10 años, cuando varias madres cabezas de hogar, con diferentes saberes comerciales, unieron sus conocimientos y decidieron poner en marcha alternativas productivas para generar ingresos a su hogar. Su trabajo lo realiza utilizando  como materia prima el cuero, en los que desarrolla sus diseños de calzado y bolsos, mediante procedimientos eminentemente manuales. Sus ventas las realiza a diversos almacenes y clientes fijos de localidades diversas, obteniendo de ellos anticipadamente el 50%  para iniciar el proceso, mientras el otro 50%,  lo recibe con la entrega del producto. Sandra permanentemente realiza sus compras en peletería  y elabora nuevos muestrarios, que exhibe directamente a su cliente o mediante catálogos. La meta del negocio es ampliar su estrategia de distribución, para lograr nuevos y rentables clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Sato Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cuero e insumos en un mayor volumen, lo que le permitirán a Sandra, ampliar el formato de su catalogo y vender mucho mas, razón de éxito de esta nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the municipality of Soledad. There they have their own business, through which she makes shoes and trains others in this art. Among her lines of products are purses, shoes, and leather goods in general. Her experience dates to 10 years ago, when various mothers who were heads of the home, with different business knowledge, united their knowledge and decided to put forth alternative products in order to generate income for the home. She does her work using leather as a base material, and she develops designs for shoes and purses through methods in manuals. 

She makes her sales in diverse stores and has regular customers from diverse localities. She obtains from them 50% of the cost beforehand in order to start the process, and she receives the other 50% when she completes the product. Sandra makes her purchases in a shoe shop and she develops samples, which she exhibits directly to her customers or through catalogs. The goal of the business is to improve the distribution strategy, in order to gain new and worthwhile customers. 

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that the Fundacion Mario Sato Domingo is making. She will use the loan to buy leather and supplies in bulk, which will allow Sandra to expand her catalog and sell much more, the reason for success for this new investment.

loans.use: to buy leather and supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Hojalatería Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Ruth  mujer soltera de 39 años de edad tiene 10 años de dedicarse a vender sartenes a las diferentes panaderías, repostería  de su localidad los sartenes son de diferentes estilos formas y tamaños, para esta temporada también comercializa en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sartenes de diferentes formas y tamaños, además cosechas de tamarindo para esta temporada que se vende por la semana santa, Maria del Carmen también se dedica a la comercialización de sartenes y Eugenia compra y vende cosechas de tamarindo.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is Ruth.  She's a 39-year-old single woman who has been selling different styles and sizes of frying pans to bakeries and pastry shops in her town for ten years.  During this season she also sells harvested tamarind.

She'll invest the loan in different types of pans and in harvested tamarind for the Holy Week season.

María del Carmen also sells frying pans and Eugenia buys and sells harvested tamarind.

loans.use: to buy frying pans and harvested tamarind

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Vilma tiene 53 años de edad, casada con tres hijos todos mayores de edad, tiene cinco años de dedicarse a vender comida y para esta temporadad se dedica  la compra y venta de cosechas de tamarindo, ella inicia su negocio con su comida en menor escala, poco fue aumentando su negocio con la variedad de comida que hoy en dia realiza, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo que es el producto que más se está comercializando por esta temporada claro sin dejar a un lado la venta de comida. Silvia tiene 27 años de edad y hace y vende tortillas en su domicilio y Isamar tiene 20 años hace y vende sartenes.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising and successful members, one of whom is Vilma.  She's a 53-year-old married woman who has three adult children.

She has been selling food for five years, and during this season she buys and sells harvested tamarind.  She started her food business on a small scale and little by little kept expanding with the variety of food she offers today.

She'll invest the loan in buying harvested tamarind, the most-sold product during this season, and will continue with her food sales.

Silvia, 27, makes and sells tortillas at home; Isamar, 20, makes and sells frying pans.

loans.use: to buy harvested tamarind

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.es: Grupo esta formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos todas originarias de la ciudad de  las flores la cuna del folklor nicaragüense una de ellas es Elia es una mujer de 59 años, casada, desde hace 25 años  se dedica a la venta de tamales pisques, tamales rellenos, tamales simples ambulante , tiene de ser cliente de la institución por 4 años, el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, queso, hojas de chagüites, leña, azúcar, leche etc. Ana tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica a fabricar artesanías de bambu, Lidia tiene 52 años también se dedica a fabricar artesanía de bambu.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful, enterprising members, all from the city of Las Flores, the home of Nicaraguan folklore. One of those is Elia, a woman aged 59, and married. For 25 years she has worked as a street vendor of various types of tamales. She will invest the loan in the purchase of raw material such as rice, cheese, banana leaves, firewood, sugar, milk, etc.

Ana is 29 years old and works making handicrafts out of bamboo. Lidia is 52 years old and also works making handicrafts out of bamboo.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as rice, cheese, banana leaves, firewood, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Leonidas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatros socios uno de los miembros es Erving tiene 30 años es casado y tiene un hijo menor. Su  negocio tiene un taller de carpintería con cinco trabajadores asalariados el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como madera, lijas, sener, sellador, pega blanca, Narcisa tiene 48 años de edad el negocio es la venta de fritanga en su domicilio , Jeovany tiene 37 años su negocio es la venta de pollo y Fatima tiene 34 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de verduras frescas.
texts.en:
This group consists of four members.  One of them is Erving, who is 30 years old, married, and has one young child.  His business is a carpentry workshop where he has five salaried employees.  His loan will be invested in raw materials such as wood, sandpaper, thinner, sealant, and white glue.  

Narcisa is 48 years old and has a business of selling fried foods from her home.  Jeovany is 37 years old and has a business of selling chickens and Fatima is 34 years old and sells fresh vegetables.

loans.use: to buy wood, sandpaper, thinner, sealant, and white glue.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, solicita un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de  invertir en el cultivo de granos básicos para generar más ingresos. Este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas como lo es: abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
Con el préstamo anterior aumento la producción y sus utilidades incrementaron, estas las invierte en los gastos del hogar. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado gracias a la inversión que realizo con el crédito de kiva.
texts.en:
Oscar is requesting a new loan to invest in growing basic grains to generate more income. 

This will allow him to buy agricultural supplies such as: fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides etc. 

With the previous loan he increased his production and his profits increased. These were invested into household costs. 

His economic situation has improved thanks to the investment he made with the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as: fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née vers 1990 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, MARIAM vit avec son  enfant et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire  à  Ouelessebougou ville. 
MARIAM n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait le commerce de légume. MARIAM, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir le commerce de légume, de produits alimentaires, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, MARIAM est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs d’attièkè, quelques sacs de légumes. Elle s’approvisionne avec les  grossistes de SIKASSO  et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle mixte. 
MARIAM espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en: Born around 1990 in Ouelessebougou, Mariam lives with her child and her husband in a nuclear family in Ouelessebougou city.  Mariam did not have the chance to advance in school.  Very quickly, she became interested in income-generating activities from her sister who had a vegetable business.  Mariam, after years of experience with her sister, opted for the same business: the sale of vegetables and food products, etc.  After fully repaying her first loan, Mariam is on her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to buy 20 bags of semolina and a few bags of vegetables.  She buys from wholesalers in Sikasso and sells for cash and for credit at her home, at the market in Ouelessebougou, and at the neighboring fairs, to a mix of customers.  Mariam hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA that will be used to help her husband support their family, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and semolina.

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es: Microempresario de éxito es Santiago que tiene 36 años de edad, casado con dos hijos menores, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollo, estos créditos le han servido para hacer galeras, lo cual las ha condicionado para la producción de pollos de buena calidad, el crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de alimentos y vitaminas para pollo de crecimiento para su comercialización al mercado.
texts.en:
Santiago is a successful micro-entrepreneur who is 36 years old, married, and has two young children.  He has been raising and selling chickens for the past eight years.  His loans have been used to build coops to help with producing chickens that are of good quality.  

This loan will be invested in the purchase of feed and vitamins for his chickens so that they can grow in order that they may be sold at the market.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Emmanual

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Emmanual. He is married and has three children ages 8, 5, and 2 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because of schooling.

In 2003, Emmanual established his Cinema/Super Sport business. He began his business because he was unable to get job when he completed school and he wanted to be self-reliant. His business is located in the outskirts and his main customers are children as well as young and old men and women. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Emmanual requires a loan in order to pay his subscription to Super Sport (an international sports station) and improve his hall. He hopes that this loan will support him through proper use.

In the future, Emmanual plans to build a house and give good education to his children. He is very hard working he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay his subscription to Super Sport and improve his entertainment hall.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina de 42 años, vivió más de  10 años en Venezuela y por la situación económica del país regresó a Colombia sin empleo. Su madre (aparece en la foto, lado  izquierdo) labora vendiendo papas fritas en un carro de comidas rápidas en la ciudad de Medellín, Colombia, por lo cual, Luz María comenzó a ayudarle, hasta que se le presentó la oportunidad de montar su propio negocio en donde vende arepas de queso desde hace ocho meses. 
Asegura que su mayor ventaja es la ubicación estratégica de su negocio debido a la alta circulación de transeúntes, lo cual le ha permitido generar mejores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar y la educación de sus tres hijos. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos y un carro de comidas rápidas con freidora y plancha para la preparación de las arepas.
Su mayor sueño es poder acreditar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 42 years old.  She lived in Venezuela for more than 10 years, but due to the economic situation, she returned to Colombia without a job.  Her mother (pictured - on the left) sells fried potatoes from a fast food cart in the city of Medellín, Colombia.  Luz Maria started out as her assistant, but then she got the opportunity to establish her own business of selling cheese arepas (flatbread that is made from cornmeal and stuffed with various fillings).  Luz has been doing this for the past eight months.  

She says that her biggest advantage is the strategic location of her business, which experiences a high level of foot traffic.  This has enabled her to generate more income to sustain her household and provide for the education of her three children.  

Luz Marina is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies and a fast food cart with a deep-fryer and a griddle for preparing arepas.  Her greatest wish is to gain recognition for her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a fast food cart equipped with a deep-fryer and a griddle.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina de 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres ya que se encarga de atenderlos y cuidarlos junto a su pequeño hijo. El trabajo de Dina consiste en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo entre los que destacan perfumes, cremas corporales, talcos y otros accesorios, tiene gran variedad de productos en stock ya que fue acumulando en varias campañas de ventas además ella las puede obtener a precios cómodos para luego venderlos pudiendo percibir muy buenas ganancias por tales ventas. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 5 años. Ofrece sus productos a sus amigos, familiares y compañeros de trabajo ya que también trabaja en un hospital de la ciudad como enfermera. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para sus demás actividades además de generarle buenos ingresos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará cosméticos conformados por perfumes, talcos, desodorantes, cremas faciales, cremas de mano, entre otros.
texts.en:
32-year-old Dina is a single mother to a 3-year-old boy. She currently lives in her parents' house, since she's responsible for looking after them and taking care of them alongside her little son. Dina's work consists of selling cosmetics by catalog, especially perfume, body lotion, powder and other accessories. She has a wide variety of products in stock, since she gradually accumulated them during several sales campaigns. Besides, she's able to get them at reasonable prices and then sell them, and she's able to earn very good profits from these sales. She has been in this business for 5 years. She offers her products to her friends, relatives and coworkers, since she also works as a nurse in one of the town's hospitals. What she enjoys about her work is that it 
allows her to have time for other activities, and in addition, it generates good profits. On this occasion she'll request 2000 nuevos soles. She's thankful to the people who make her loan possible and provide her with the opportunity to keep on working in order to achieve her goals. With the requested amount she'll purchase cosmetics comprised of perfume, powder, deodorant, face cream and hand cream, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, powder and lotion, among other items.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana, 34 años de edad, originario de León, acompañada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 2, 5 y 15 años respectivamente, actualmente solo dos de  ellos estudian, el otro no estudia todavía, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a  la elaboración y venta de tortillas, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 10 años, solo logro finalizar su primer año de secundaria.
Inicio en el ámbito  del comercio desde muy joven vendiendo tortillas, con capital propio, ya que ella necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y poder salir adelante con su familia, la cual con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido mantener estable su negocio que le genera ganancias a diario, porque cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus productos lo comercializa en su casa, una de su  expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio.
Ana esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar maíz, leña y zinc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus tortillas y a la misma vez poder mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde hacen sus tortillas, dentro de sus planes futuros es poder ampliar su negocio para vender otros productos, una de sus metas próximas  es cancelar el crédito para volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Ana, age 34, is from León, and she has a life partner.  She has three children, ages 2, 5, and 15.  Only two of them currently go to school; the other one does not yet go.


She is a merchant, and she makes and sells tortillas.  She has had this business for over ten years.  She only managed to complete her first year of high school.  She started selling tortillas when she was very young.  She started in this field with her own capital because she needed a way to survive and to be able to get ahead with her family.  

With great effort and hard work she has been able to keep her business stable, and it generates daily profits for her.  This is because she has fixed customers.  This has been her first business, and she sells her products at her house.  One of her expectations is to make her business grow.

Ana is requesting the loan to buy corn, firewood, and zinc.  She thinks that this loan will help her to buy all of the raw material that she needs to make the tortillas.  She will also be able to improve the infrastructure of the place where she makes the tortillas.

Within her plans for the future is being able to expand her business in order to sell other products.  One of her next goals is to repay the loan in order to request another one.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and zinc.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, una humilde campesina de 58 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 16 años de edad, ella habita en la comarca La Cuesta en las afuera de Teustepe. Se dedica a la venta de pollo, cuajada y verduras su esposo trabaja en la siembra de frijol y trigo  junto con su hijo. Las tierras donde siembran su familia las heredo de su papa. Parte de sus actividades diarias desde tempranas horas es ordeñar las vacas para obtener leche y hacer sus cuajadas que vende. Durante el verano cuando la producción de leche es baja ella sale a vender utensilios plásticos y verduras junto con su hijo y de esta manera conseguir ingresos para sobrevivir y salir adelante. 
Ella esta requiriendo el crédito para comprar panas, baldes, chucharas, picheles, termos, vasos, platos de plástico. Desea ir creciendo como comerciante diversificar y obtener otras formas de ingresos. 
Una de sus metas próximas es preparar el terreno para la siembra de maíz y frijol y sacar una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 58-year-old humble farmer. She is a mother to a 16-year-old boy. She lives in the town of La Cuesta from the suburbs of Teustepe. She sells poultry, curd, and vegetables. Her husband farms beans and wheat with her son. The land that they use to cultivate was inherited from her father. Part of her daily activities is to milk the cows from early in the morning and make her curd that she sells. During the summer when the milk production is low, she sells plastic utensils and vegetables along with her son. This way they can earn income to survive and get ahead. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase pans, buckets, spoons, jars, thermos, glasses, and plastic plates. She wants to grow as a commercial agent and search for sources to diversify her income.  One of her upcoming goals is to prepare the land to grow beans and corn and yield a high quality product.

loans.use: to purchase pans, buckets, spoons, jars, thermos, glasses, and plastic plates

loans.name: Entimo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Entimo es una persona trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   producción  de  granos  básicos y  leche.
Don Entimo está solicitando el préstamo para comprar 1 batería  y televisor, ya que la batería que tenia actualmente no le esta funcionado y en la comunidad donde vive no hay servicio de energía eléctrica y necesita la bateria para la conexion de sus electrodomesticos, con esta inversión espera mejorar un poco su   calidad  de vida y la de su familia. 
Don Entimo en unos años espera que su vida y situación  económica mejore y seguir  apoyando  a  sus hijos para que  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades para  la  sociedad. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Marzo  del   2013
texts.en:
Entimo is a hard working and honest person. He lives with his spouse and their two children in a community of Choluteca in southern Honduras. His business is the production of bulk grains and milk.

Entimo is asking for this loan to buy 1 battery and a television set, since the battery he has currently isn't working, and in the community where he lives there is no electricity and he needs a battery to run his home appliances. With this investment he hopes to improve his quality of life a bit and that of his family.

Entimo hopes that his life and economic situation improve in a few years. He hopes to continue supporting his children and that they grow into good people with better opportunities in society.

Choluteca, Honduras - March, 2013

loans.use: to buy a battery and a television set

loans.name: Iswar Allah Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in the year 2011 and named Iswar Allah JLG. It is a group comprising of four women members (two members from the Hindu community and two members from the Muslim community) from the hamlet of Fokat Pada in the village of Gadramunda. The specialty of this hamlet is that all the inhabitants were landless and the government provided them with small patches of land free of cost to construct house for residential purposes.  It is located in the Nuapada district, one of the poorest districts of India. One of the members of this group is Chandrika who is standing second from left with her hand raised in the photo. She is an energetic lady of 32 years whose family consists of her husband, two daughters of 15 and 11 years and one son of 13 years. The elder daughter of Chandrika has already married, the second daughter is studying in class 9 and her son is studying in class 7. 

Chandrika has been running a bakery factory in her house with the help of her husband. Her husband started the business 20 years ago with a small investment of his own. In the factory, bakery items like bread, roll, cream and toast etc. are being prepared. She has engaged four skilled laborers for processing and making the bakery items for which she has to pay daily from 100 – 135 INR plus breakfast and lunch. Her husband also works in the factory. She supplies the products to retailers in nearby villages and vendors also regularly take the products from her. Chandrika says owing to better quality, design, packing and forms of her products, there is a lot of demand from the locals, but due to a shortage of stock she can not meet their demands. Chandrika earns a monthly net profit of 8,000 INR, which is not sufficient to maintain the family expenses, educational expenses of her children and business expenses like payments to the laborers etc. To increase the income, Chandrika wants to buy more stock of oil, dough, sugar etc. to increase her production level to meet the demands and grab her customers. So Chandrika is planning to use the present loan for purchasing raw materials in bulk, which will reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, and for making a new kiln. She also hopes to save money from the sale proceeds to provide a better education facility to her children and construct a new house. 

The other three active members of the group are Fatma, Mumataj and Mangala who are doing mutton, fancy items and a vending business, respectively, hoping to provide better education to their children and increase their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for oil, dough, sugar etc.

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es:
LAURO
El señor Lauro es un señor muy trabajador, la cual se dedica a la plantación y venta de rosas naturales e injertadas. Los pedidos siguen creciendo y los clientes hacen varios pedidos, cuenta con varios metros de cultivo de rosas y actualmente se aproxima la primer cosecha del año y el se ve en la necesidad de comprar  nylon porque necesita techar la siembra y así obtener una mejor cosecha.  El no cuenta con el dinero necesario y por eso el hace una nueva solicitud de crédito para poder comprar lo que necesita como nylon, fertilizantes en líquidos,y abono espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Lauro is a very hardworking man who makes a living farming and selling natural and grafted roses.  Demand keeps growing and his customers make a lot of requests.  He has several meters of roses planted.

Currently the first harvest of the year is coming up and he needs to buy nylon to put a roof over the field to get a better harvest.  He doesn't have enough money so he's requesting another loan to be able to buy what he needs, such as nylon, liquid fertilizer, and soil amendments.

He hopes he can get help with the loan he has requested.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and soil amendments

loans.name: Los Positos Group

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es madre soltera soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene un hijo, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino, inició este negocio criando gallinas ponedoras y luego le surgio la idea de criar cerditos y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia; también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mas cerdos y concentrado para los mismos, en el futuro quiere tener una granja de cerdos y gallinas; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agropecuarias y al comercio.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 24-year-old single mother, who had no opportunity to study. She has a son and raises pigs. Lidia began this business by raising 'ponedora' hens. Later, the idea occurred to her to raise little pigs. Now, Lidia has 3 years experience. In addition, she can count on the assistance of her husband who is a merchant.

Lidia organized a group and requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more pigs and feed for pigs. In the future, she wishes to have a pig and chicken farm.

The remaining members of the group are dedicated to agricultural activities and to commerce.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Hugo Apolonio

texts.es:
Hugo un humilde habitante de León, de 49 años de edad, casado, padre de 1 hijo de 26 años, independiente, de oficio comerciante, es dueño de  una pulpería.
Inicio su negocio con ayuda de un amigo quien le regalo $ 800, fue allí que decidió emprender su propio negocio de pulpería, ya que el necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y generar ingresos por si solo, el dice que en su pulpería le va muy bien ya que es un negocio muy rentable y le genera ganancias a diario, este ha sido su primer negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien le ayuda a administrar su negocio, recibe otros ingresos como es el dinero que le pagan como administrador de una empresa, una de sus expectativa es hacer crecer su negocio para que le genere mas ganancias.
Hugo esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  un frízer y comprar mas mercadería como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, etc. Con el objetivo de ofrecer más productos frescos a sus clientes,   el  estima que este crédito le ayudara a  comprar  todos los productos que aun no tiene en inventario y de esta manera poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, uno de sus planes futuro es poder cancelar este crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Hugo, a humble inhabitant of León, is 49 years old, married and has a 26-year-old son. Hugo is an independent salesman; he owns a grocery store. He started this business with the help of a friend, who gave him $800. He decided to start his own business selling groceries because he needed to survive and generate his own income. Hugo says that he does well with his store because it is a profitable business that gives him daily profits. This is his first business and his wife supports him and helps him to run it. He receives an additional income working as a manager for a company. One of his goals is to expand his business and generate greater profits.

Hugo is requesting a loan to buy a freezer and supplies such as rice, sugar, beans and oil. With the intention to offer his customers more and fresher products, he believes that this loan will help him to buy all the products he does not have in stock and to satisfy his customers. One of his goals is to pay back this loan so that he can request a new one.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and supplies for his store, such as rice, sugar, beans and oil.

loans.name: Rosamira

texts.es: Rosamira de 45 años de edad , esta casada y es madre de cuatro hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia quienes aún dependen de ella .El trabajo de Rosamira consiste en la venta de abarrotes como galletas, arroz, jabones, huevos, leche, azúcar, aceites y otros. Ella es dueña de una tienda muy concurrida que instaló en su casa y ahí ofrece todos estos productos de primera necesidad los que complementa con la venta de productos farmacéuticos y otras medicinas. Lleva en este negocio 1 año y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que está a lado de sus hijos y puede estar permanentemente cuidándolos y supervisando sus actividades.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará productos para implementar su bodega con los artículos de consumo más solicitados como arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, condimentos, embutidos, etc.
texts.en: Rosamira is 45 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She lives in her own home with her family who are still dependent on her.  Rosamira’s job is selling groceries such as cookies, rice, soap, eggs, milk, sugar, oil, and other products.  She is the owner of a very busy store set up in her home and there, she provides all the basic necessities that complement sales of pharmaceuticals and other medications.  She has been in this business for one year and it is going very well.  What she likes about her job is that she is near her children and can continually care for them and supervise their activities.  At this time, she is requesting S/. 800 soles.  She is grateful to those who make access to this financing possible because it will enable her to feel more confident to move forward with her business.  She promises to make her payments on time.  She will use the requested amount to purchase products to supply her grocery store with the most requested consumer goods such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, condiments, sausage, etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, condiments, sausage, etc.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Viene de un lindo pueblo del departamento de Cundinamarca, con muchos anhelos de superación para salir adelante y con ellos conseguir un buen trabajo y además estable.
En realidad de donde ella viene no es que este muy bien económicamente por que su mama no tenía trabajo y su papa un agricultor humilde y pues con lo que ganaban les colaboraban a sus  hijos, por motivos de salud no pudo conseguir un trabajo rápido y no era una posibilidad estudiar, tomo la decisión de viajar a la gran ciudad y poder progresar, así que intento ingresar a varias instituciones pero no era posible, un día caminando por la calle encontró un volante de Campoalto y supo que ese sería el sitio de estudio, encontró su pasión el programa de Cocina, sabía que con esto su vida cambiaría, ella les comento a sus padres la posibilidad de estudiar y ellos con mucho amor deciden apoyarla.
Con mucho esfuerzo consiguieron el dinero de la matricula y mes a mes todos se esfuerzan por qué Adriana pueda seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Adriana comes from a beautiful town in the department of Cundinamarca, with a strong desire to do better, get ahead, and get a good job and be more stable.

Currently, the situation that she comes from is not very strong economically, as her mother doesn’t have a job and her father is a humble farmer; what they did earn, they shared with their children. 

For health reasons, Adriana was not able to find work quickly and was not able to study. She made the decision to travel to the big city and make progress; she tried to get admitted to various educational institutions, but this was not possible. 

One day while walking down the street, she came across a flyer for Campoalto and knew that this would be the place where she would study. Adriana found her passion with the Cooking program; she knew that it would change her life. 

She told her parents about the possibility of studying there, and with all their love, they decided to support her. With a lot of effort, they obtained the money for registration, and month after month, they all worked hard so that Adriana would be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to complete her cooking studies in Campoalto.

loans.name: Duo Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es:
DÚO SAGRADO CORAZON
la señora Dominga quien tiene una tortillería, tiene varios años dedicándose a vender tortillas y tiene dos empleadas, también vende algunos almuerzos y refacciones a algunas personas que trabajan por el sector.  Ella se ve en la necesidad de pedir un nuevo préstamo ya que no tiene mucho maíz en reserva y como también a crecido la demanda de sus clientes en la compra de almuerzos que le piden y el dinero no le alcanza para la compra de las verduras y carnes para preparar la comida, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz, y para la compra de verduras para la elaboracion de almuerzoz.

Su compañera doña Maria se dedica al bordado de fajas, y elaboración de blusas de croshe, también se ve en la necesidad de hacer un nuevo préstamo porque necesita comprar varios artículos de la tienda ya que le hacen falta muchas cosas como pastas, granos, azúcar, golosinas, galletas y más.
texts.en:
SAGRADO CORAZON Group

Dominga has a tortilla store. She has been selling tortillas for many years and has two employees. She also sells lunch food and snacks to people who work in the sector. She has requested a new loan because her maize reserves are running out and she has seen more demand for lunches. Offering up other dishes to her customers has meant that now she hasn't got enough money to buy vegetables and meat to prepare the food.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy corn, and vegetable in order to prepare her lunch dishes.   

Maria makes embroidered sashes and belts and crocheted tops. She also needs to ask for a loan to buy various items she needs for the shop, such as pastries, grains, sugar, sweets, biscuits and other things.

loans.use: to buy corn, and vegetable in order to prepare her lunch dishes.

location.town: Cantón San Francisco, Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Ped

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata, who is 24 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 1 year. 

In 2010, Aminata established her slippers business. She began her business to help out at home. Her business is located in Out-Skits, and she sells to everyone, men, women and children.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 300,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to purchase different kinds of slippers.  She hopes that this loan will help her business to grow through proper use.   In the future, Aminata plans to go back to the university. She is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for resale.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Feliz Antonio soltero de 54 años de edad,  con cinco hijos mayores de edad, originario de León. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre, le gusta disfrutar de programa de televisión, y tomar una tasa de café.  Él es un hombre trabajador, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamententablemente no pudo  terminar  estudios por falta de recursos económicos, se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad.


Gracias a su espíritu de superación  tiene por actividad económica servicio de reparación de electrodomésticos eléctricos  como cocinas, abanicos, refrigeradoras, radios, equipo de sonidos, lámparas, a domicilio y en su casa de habitación. el dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar repuestos de electrodoméstico eléctrico para reparar y ofrecer mejorar servicio al cliente. Repuestos como parlantes, transistores, tubos, tornillas, pantalla de televisión, cajones, cables.  Félix Antonio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Felix Antonio, single, is 54 years old. He has five grown children. He is originally from León which is located in the western part of the country. In his free time he enjoys watching TV and drinking a cup of coffee. He is a hard worker, responsible, with hopes of succeeding. Unfortunately he could not finish school because of a lack of financial resources. He was obliged to work from an early age.

Thanks to his conquering spirit he has a business repairing electrical appliances such as stoves, fans, refrigerators, radios, sound equipment, and lighting dedicating 10 hours daily to his business from a room at his house. 

He plans to use the loan to invest in working capital to buy parts for electric appliances in order to repair and provide better service to the clients, such as speakers, transistors, tubes, screws, television screens, containers, and wires. Felix Antonio is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a way to work decently.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to supply his business with the purchase of electrical parts such as speakers, transistors, tubes, screws, television screens, containers and wires.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has three children. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops, and he has been doing this work for four years. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming, "milking the dairy cows." His biggest challenges are diseases like animal and crop diseases and also lack of enough funds. The animal on the farm is named “Lelgina.”

Alfred was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, “low interest rates.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and he replied, “geared towards improving our lives.”

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Alfred replied, “improve living standards.”

As part of Juhudi Kilimo’s loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alfred owns “a cow and poultry”, but does not own “a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile.” 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household “a mosquito net and solar power”, but does not have “electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.”

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purhase fabric.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is Joseph, who is 35 years old.  He is married and has two children, aged 9 and 6 years. 

In 2006, Joseph established a business photocopying, printing and laminating.  His business is located in City Center, and his main customers are the general community.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 400,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000 to increase his stock of stationery to meet the demand of the customers. He hopes that this loan will help his business grow. In the future, Joseph plans to continue his project. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stationery for resale

loans.name: Ouindinmanegde Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTA est la représentante du groupe OUINDINMANEGDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des plats plastiques  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de Sankaryaar. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes. 
Elle veut s’acheter  03 fus en plastiques, 07douzaines de plats et 01douzaine de carafes.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne  s’acheter une parcelle et construire.
texts.en:
Madam Binta is the representative of the group OUINDINMANEGDE. She is well. Married, she is mother to 3 children. The oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Two go to school and she has 4 dependents.

Madam has been selling plastic dishes for 5 years. She gets her supplies at the market in Sankaryaar. Her customers are women and men.

She wants to buy herself 3 plastic containers, 7 dozen dishes and 1 dozen carafes. 

Madam wants to reinvest her profits in her business. She has the ambition of buying a plot of land and building on it.

loans.use: to buy herself 3 plastic containers, 7 dozen dishes and 1 dozen carafes.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
In the year 2009, four active women from Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India formed a group named Maa Mahalaxmi to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Lilabati is one of them. The smiling lady of 41 years standing at the extreme right in the photo and raising her hand is Lilabati. 

Lilabati lives with her husband and two daughters, aged 15 and 13 years. Her family belongs to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day.  Her elder daughter is studying +2 science, and the younger daughter is studying in ninth standard.

Lilabati has been running a general grocery shop in her locality for the last five years. This is the only source of income for her family. She started the business in a very low-profile manner with a small investment of her own. At that time, her monthly net income was around 2,000 INR. It was very difficult for Lilabati to maintain her family and meet the educational and other expenses. 

After formation of the group, Lilabati took the first loan of 10,000 INR and purchased some grocery items like potatoes, onions, oil, sugar, tea dust, etc. After six months, her business started its growth, and simultaneously her income was also increased manifold. With her second loan of 25,000 INR, Lilabati again purchased some more items, and customers started knowing her business better. With the third loan of 30,000 INR, she added a shelf to her grocery shop and made a counter table with glass to have a good look, which will attract the customers and thereby increase sales. 

During this period, Lilabati did an innovative idea by motivating a lady to start a tiffin center (lunches or lunches-to-go) adjoining her shop, so that she could sell oil, sugar, dough, potatoes, etc. regularly. This idea of Lilabati’s was materialized, and she earned some extra income. 

Lilabati’s husband actively helps and supplements her business. Within a short span, Lilabati successfully was able to increase the monthly income level from 2,000 to 7,000 INR. Out of this, she was able to send her elder daughter to the capital city of Odisha (Bhubaneswar) for studying +2 science. 

As per her statement, Lilabati was able to increase the variety of items in her shop, but not the inventory. She wants to increase the stock of raw materials. So, according to Lilabati, a portion of the present loan amount will be used to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, etc. for her general store, and the other portion will be used for extension and repairing of the storeroom. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she will replenish her stock frequently. 

Lilabati hopes to save enough for building a good house for her family, as the present house is very small. She also has a dream to give a better education to both of her daughters. Lilabati, with a sentimental mood, expressed her satisfaction that she has achieved the total success due to the timely support of Mahashakti Foundation.

The other three members of the group are Subarni, Kanakamanjari and Sanjukta, who are running general grocery shops and tiffin stall businesses.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, lentils, oil, etc.

loans.name: Tassie
