Porferia has been farming vegetables for 20 years and also earns additional income from rag-making and coconut-grinding. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to purchase a lot where she will build a house for her family and business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
A retailing business is the primary source of income for Marivic. She has been in this business for ten years. She is now 44 years old and is happily married to Joel. The couple is thankful because they had been blessed with four children. 

As of now, Marivic wants to re-stock her sari-sari store. In this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, biscuits, and condiments to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business. Marivic hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, biscuits, and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con sus padres y hermanos en casa propia. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economicay seguir ayudando a sus padres como siempre lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
This client has been farming for 10 years. He plants beans and corn, and sales from the harvest cover his household expenses. He is responsible, honest, and hardworking. He lives with his parents and siblings in their own house.

He has applied for a loan to buy supplies for the harvest because his earnings will not cover these expenses. This way, he will have more income and greater financial stability. He will keep helping his parents, as he has always done.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 23 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a transportation service in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and new tires for better service. She  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires for better service

loans.name: Mehrafruz

texts.ru: Мехрафруз позитивная, добродушная, ответственная женщина в возрасте 34 лет. Она замужем и  имеет троих прекрасных детей. Её муж хороший семьянин и добрый отец для своих детей. Он работает мастером в автосервисе и имеет средний доход. До замужества Мехрафруз училась в медицинском колледже и получила для себя знания и опыт в сфере медицинского обслуживания. Но после того, как она вышла замуж и появились дети, Мехрафруз пришлось оставить свою профессию и заниматься своими детьми и домашним хозяйством. Но для того, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход в семье она начала своё маленькое дело - откармливание скота. Этим она может заниматься, находясь дома. От откармливания и продажи скота она получает хорошую прибыль, что влияет на экономическое положение и качество жизни её семьи. Сейчас у неё в наличии есть  несколько  голов крупно рогатого  скота, но она хочет чтобы её бизнес расширялся и приносил больше дохода, потому что сейчас она думает о будущем своих детей и мечтает о том, чтобы они получили хорошее образование и профессию. Но вместе с тем, что она занимается откормом скота, также дополнительно у себя дома она предоставляет медицинские услуги людям, соседям за определённую плату. Она оказывает скорую помощь, делает  уколы, ставит капельницы и многое другое. И сейчас Мехрафруз хочет получить в ООО МДО Арванд кредит для покупки одного крупно рогатого скота для  дальнейшей реализации своего малого бизнеса и заранее благодарит за поддержку!
texts.en: Mehrafruz is a positive, kindhearted and responsible woman. She is 34 years old and has three wonderful children. Her husband is a good family man and kind father to his children. He works as a master mechanic in an automotive shop and has a decent salary. Before she married Mehrafruz attended medical college and has a degree in medical services. But after her children were born Mehrafruz left her profession to take care of the kids and the household. However, to earn more money for her family she has started a small business raising cattle. She is able to take care of her animals without leaving home and earns a good profit from livestock sales, which influences her family's the economic situation and quality of life. Currently Mehrafruz has a few heads of cattle but wants to expand her business and her profits. She also offers medical services in her home to her neighbors. She can administer urgent care, perform injections and insert IVs as well as other medical services. Savings from her businesses will allow her to improve the future of her children as Mehrafruz wants them to receive good education and good professions. Currently Mehrafruz is requesting a loan to purchase another cow for her herd which will allow her to expand. She is grateful in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Cindy Rosalinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Cindy es originaria de Piedras Negras en donde tiene viviendo desde hace 25 años, es una persona muy responsable, es ama de casa y además labora en un salón de belleza cortando cabello. Es una mujer viuda, ya que hace un año perdió a su esposo de edad jóven cuando se encontraba laborando  y tiene tres dependientes economicos, él le dejo una pensión con la cuál han salido adelante a pesar de esto, la Sra. Cindy es una persona que lucha día a día por darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
Pide apoyo a través de KIVA porque quiere pintar por fuera de su casa para que luzca agradable al momento que la visiten y sus hijos se sientan comódos.
Sus vecinos comentan que es una muy buena persona y muy buena mamá.
texts.en:
Cindy is a native of Piedras Negras, where she has lived for 25 years.  She's a very responsible person.  She's a homemaker who also works in a beauty salon cutting hair.

She's a widow because a year ago she lost her husband at a young age when he was working.  He left her a pension with which she and her three financial dependents have gotten ahead despite everything.  Cindy's a person who strives every day to give her children the best.

She's requesting help through Kiva because she wants to paint the outside of her house so it looks nice when people visit her and so her children feel more comfortable.

Her neighbors say she's a good person and a very good mother.

loans.use: to paint the outside of her house

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
This is Anabel, 36, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a security officer, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anabel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

Anabel is requesting a Php 50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Anabel hopes to eventually have a grocery store, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Толибчону 24 года. Он родился в семье рабочих и с детства рос в малообеспеченной семье. Толибчон всегда мечтал поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. По семейному обстоятельству он не смог поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Он начал работать в разных местах разнорабочим и таким образом подрабатывал на жизнь. Подработав деньги, он купил машину и более 1 года он занимается услугой такси. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 сына, которому 2 года. После того, как он начал этот бизнес, его домохозяйство улучшилась и теперь он хочет развивать бизнес дальше. Для этого он должен купить новую машину, так как его машина имеет плохое  состояние. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки машины. Он ждет ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет ему развивать бизнес и таким образом получить больше дохода.
texts.en: Tolibjon is 24 years old. He was born into a working class family and grew up poor. Tolibjon always dreamed of attending the university and receive a bachelor's degree, but his family's situation prevented it. Instead, after school he started doing odd jobs and so made a modest living. After saving some money Tolibjon was able to buy a car and has been offering taxi services for about a year. He is married and has a two year old son. Tolibjon's taxi business significantly improved the living situation of his family and he wants to further expand his business. For this purpose he needs to buy a better car as his car is old and in bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase a new car. He is hoping for your charity as this loan will help him increase his profits and improve the life of his young family.

loans.use: to buy a car for his taxi business

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.ru: Иномджону 25 лет. Он хороший, добрый, трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный молодой человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 2 года. Иномджон более 2 года занимается купле продажей скота. Он справляется с бизнесом хорошо и постепенно изучает все тонкости своего дела. Иномджон покупает скот, присматривает за скотом от 1 месяца до 6 месяцев и перепродает на местном рынке по более высокой цене. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Он хочет развивать бизнес дальше, а для этого он должен купить дополнительный скот. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки скота. Он надеется на ваше милосердие и обещает погасить займ во время. Он очень благородный человек.
texts.en: Inomjon is 25 years old. He is a good, kind, hardworking and happy young man. Inomjon is married and has a toddler. For the last two years he has been raising cattle for a living. He is good at managing the animals and is steadily learning the finer aspects of the trade. Inomjon purchases skinny young cattle, takes care of them for one to six months then sells the fattened animals at the market for a higher price. His wife helps Inomjon take care of the cows. Inomjon wants to expand his herd and is requesting a loan of 3000 US dollars for purchasing more cattle. He hopes for your charity and promises to repay the loan on time. He is a very grateful man.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase his working capital

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van was born in 1969. She has two sons who are workers. Her husband makes aluminum frame glass doors. He earns 4,500,000 VND per month. 

Van raises chickens and grows rice to earn a living. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Van has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last cycle she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens. She wants to use the profit to enlarge her chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 52 years old, married, and blessed with eight children. He runs a retail shop, a business he started one year ago, and earns a monthly income of KES. 40,000.

He is borrowing a first loan of KES. 50,000. He plans to purchase more stock for his business such as crates of sodas, sugar, bread and milk. The profit he makes will be ploughed back into his business. 


He dreams of opening up a big supermarket in town and being a well-renowned businessman in this region.

loans.use: To purchase crates of sodas, sugar, bread and milk.

loans.name: Hao

texts.en:
Hao was born in 1971. She has two sons. Her older son is a worker. Her younger son is studying at secondary school. Her husband works as a guard. His income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. 

Hao sells clothing to earn a living. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more clothing to sell at the market. She always wants to use her profits to enlarge her clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell at the market.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena es madre de nueve hijos, razón por la cual trabaja incansablemente para generar los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento y la educación su familia. Su cónyuge también labora pero los gastos sobrepasan su salario, por lo cual Luz optó por generar ingresos y solventar las necesidades urgentes en el hogar. 
Debido a que aun tiene hijos menores de edad, esta mujer se dedica a la venta de accesorios en plata con el fin de estar pendiente de sus hijos.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía.
Espera que con esta inversión, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y que sus hijos puedan gozar de una buena educación.
texts.en:
Luz Elena is the mother of nine children, so she works tirelessly to generate enough income to support the family and provide an education.  Her husband also works but expenses exceed his salary, so Luz decided to generate an income to pay for the home’s urgent needs.

Since she still has young children, this lady sells silver accessories in order to care for children.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise.  She hopes that this investment will improve her family’s life and allow her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy silver accessories.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de progresar en la vida, Cuenta que aprendió el oficio por tradición familiar y lo perfeccionó cuando le dieron la oportunidad de laborar en un taller de confección. 
Con el fin de estar pendiente del cuidado de su hijo, decidió retirarse en donde laboraba y crear su propio taller de confección. Gracias a esta actividad, ha logrado salir adelante ofreciéndole a su familia un buen futuro y mejores oportunidades de vida.
Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio e incrementar el nivel de producción y para lograrlo se encuentran solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de insumos (hilos, resortes, telas). Espera poder ahorrar el dinero necesario para comprar su propia vivienda
texts.en:
Luz Dary is 46 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has a strong desire to progress in life. She explains that she learned her trade through family tradition and perfected it when she was given the opportunity to work in a sewing workshop.

With the goal of being available to care for her son, she decided to retire from her job and establish her own sewing workshop. Thanks to this business, she has managed to carry on providing a good future and better life opportunities to her family.

Her greatest dream is to expand her business and increase her level of production; to achieve that goal, she is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase supplies like thread, elastic, and fabric. She hopes to be able to save the money she needs to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy supplies like thread, elastic, and fabric.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 32 years old, married, and supports two of his family members. He is blessed with one child who is one years and six months. He sells secondhand clothing and has been operating this business for a period of four years, earning an income of KES. 20,000 monthly.

He has borrowed a second loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase bales of men's and ladies' trousers to sell. The anticipated amounts from his business will be kept as savings for purchasing a plot in the future.

His dream is to own a plot and build his personal home.

loans.use: To purchase bales of men's and ladies' trousers to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 64 years old, married and a mother of four children. She operates a tailoring shop in Malindi Town, and has been in the business for the last four years. She earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of 40,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to buy more cloth material for making dresses in her business.  


She will save the anticipated profit and help to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Rose hopes to grow her tailoring shop, as she intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: to buy more cloth material for making dresses in her business.

loans.name: Maricarr

texts.en:
For over two years in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Maricarr, a 51-year-old, married mother of three children, has made a living through the operation of a retail business, selling a variety of food products in the community. She earns PHP 5,000 a month for these activities. Recently, Maricarr joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). 

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase new items, such as candies, chips, and biscuits. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve, for use in future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items for her business, such as candies, chips, and biscuits.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, 44 years old, married, and the mother of four, is from the village of Villa Domingo where she generates income through her sari-sari store. In business for two years, she earns a minimum of PHP 250 a day.

Loreta is now reqeusting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits and other kitchen ingredients to sell. She believes the loan will help increase her income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits and other kitchen ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La Sra. Emma sigue con la actividad de la venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de electrodomésticos para facilitara la elaboración de sus platillos deliciosos, creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida  como abarrotes y Aceite, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Emma continues with her job selling food.  She says the previous loan went well for her because she used it to buy electrical appliances to help make her delicious dishes.  She grew in her activity and increased her customers and, as a result, her income.

She's requesting this loan to buy supplies such as groceries and oil to make food.

She's happy and grateful for this new opportunity that's being given to her.

loans.use: to buy groceries and oil

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Empezó a vender cosméticos  a su familia después empezó a distribuir abriendo paso entre sus amistades en Playas donde vivia. En la actualidad vive en Guayaquil y le vende a sus amistades los cosmeticos. Tambien en ocaciones viaja a Playas para vender a sus familiares. 

Trabaja sola  vende perfumes de hombre y de mujer, cremas etc. Su dificultada es su salud que no la deja trabajar como se debe ya que es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida). No es casa tiene un hijo de 18 años.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar cosmeticos y perfumes para poder tener mas ingresos ya que la innundacion que hubo por donde vive le daño los electrodomesticos de su casa, y por eso quiere esforzarce mas en las ventas.  

Su sueño es poder disfrutar junto a su familia rehacer su vida buscar alguien q la ame como es, poder tener un local para distribuir sus productos.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil.  She started out by selling cosmetics to her family. Later, she started to distribute them to her friends in Playas, where she used to live.  Now she lives in Guayaquil, and she sells cosmetics to her friends.  At times, she also travels to Playas to sell to her family members.

She works on her own, selling scents for men and women, creams, etc.  The main difficulty she faces is her health, because as she is a patient who is living with HIV/AIDS, she cannot work as she should.   She is not married, and she has an 18 year-old son.

With this loan, she wants to buy cosmetics and perfumes so that she can have more income, because with the floods they had where she lives, the appliances in her house were damaged.  This is why she wants to put more effort into her sales.

Her dreams include: being able to enjoy her family, rebuilding her life and looking for someone who will love her as she is, and being able to have a store where she could distribute her products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia, 57, is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, a pedicab driver, and is a mother to her four children. She manages her household while also operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Renegia operates a side car transportation business. She has three units of side cars, or bicycle carts that carry up to two passengers, which transport people to their destinations within the community. Her regular customers are workers and employees in the community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Renegia is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of the pedicab units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Remegia dreams that her business will continue to be successful and she will be able to acquire more pedicabs. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week. During these meetings, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her pedicabs.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: Doña Maria De 50 años de edad tiene una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años vende todo tipo de productos como golosinas, granos basicos, productos de uso personal, entre otras cosas; asi como se muestra en la fotografia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante y poder pagar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hija, el yerno y su nieto, los cuales tambien ayudan en los gastos de hogar, Doña Maria esta solicitando un credito para poder surtir su tienda con mas productos ya que tiene mucha clientela y asi obtener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su hogar
texts.en:
María, 50, has had a store in her house for eight years.  She sells all types of products, such as sweets, basic staple items, personal care products, and other things, just as the photograph shows.  With her profits she manages to get ahead and be able to pay for her household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband, daughter, son-in-law, and grandchild, who also help with the expenses.

María's requesting a loan to be able to stock her store with more products because she has a lot of customers.  This way she'll earn better profits and continue helping with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy sweets, oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Oriol

texts.es: El Sr. Oriol sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de abarrotes y refrescos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes y galletas por mayor ya que incremento sus ventas y desea surtir su tienda, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Oriol continues with his same job selling basic staples in his neighborhood store.  He says the previous loan went well for him because he used it to buy groceries and soft drinks.

Currently he's requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as groceries and cookies wholesale because his sales increased and he wants to stock his store.

He's happy and grateful about the opportunity he's being given to grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as groceries and cookies

loans.name: Frank Yamundu Group

texts.en:
Kevina is a 42-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been in the agriculture sector for three years, and she is involved in a number of projects such as a piggery, poultry, and crop farming.  She also sells cassava flour to earn extra income.

Like all good mothers, she dreams of educating her children up to the University level.   Unpredictable weather changes and the high cost of feed pose challenges to her business growth. 

While her dream is to become a model farmer, Kevina intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.  She is a member of the above mentioned group, where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Batkhuyag is a 42-year-old married man who has two sons and one daughter. He lives with his family in Darkhan, Mongolia. His two sons attend a local university while his daughter stays at home. He works as a doorman at a kindergarten and his wife works as a retailer.
With his family income he built a house in his yard and bought two cars and also he is paying his son’s tuition fees. This shows that he is very hardworking man. Currently he is preparing to renovate his old fence, so he is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary breezeblocks and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate his fence.

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en: Gedion is a 48-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. After realizing from his own experience that many farmers had challenges accessing farm supplies, he decided to deal in agro chemicals and has been in business for seven years. The seasonality of his business is a major hindrance to achieving his vision, while his dream is to diversify and venture into extensive sorghum, maize and tomato crops which have a ready market. Gedion intends to use the loan to buy maize, tomato and sorghum seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize, tomato and sorghum seeds for planting.

loans.name: Fredah

texts.en:
Fredah resides in Nkubu, Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. She is 32 years old, married and a mother of three children who are all in school. She has been a farmer for five years, growing tobacco, maize and beans which she sells in the local market. Besides farming, she also has a retail shop and a hotel as an extra source of income.

Fredah has requested a loan of KES. 50,000 to purchase poultry. Venturing into this business will help lift her living standards. In the future, she plans to start exporting her products. The challenges she faces in running her business are poor infrastructure and the lack of a proper market for her products.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Saturday

texts.en: Saturday is a 26-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop but also farms in order to raise money for his family. He is a good father who hopes to support his children's education into the university and to build a permanent residential house for them. Price fluctuation is his major hardship while his dreams are to trade in wholesale and venture into mechanized agriculture. Saturday intends to use the loan to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion resides in Nkubu, Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. He is married and has three children. He has been a farmer for over 20 years, growing bananas and other crops.

He has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of KES. 60,000 to purchase water pipes and a generator. The income generated from the use of this loan will help him pay school fees and improve his family's living standards.

His major challenge is little rainfall. He likes Juhudi for its faster processing of loans.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes and a generator.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 75-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been farming for 50 years, works six days a week and six hours a day. He also sells health products to supplement his income. His challenges are soil exhaustion resulting in poor yields, drought and price fluctuation. His plan is to rehabilitate his banana plantation so as to increase output. His major customers are market vendors. Francis intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, to rehabilitate his plantation.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer to rehabilitate his plantation.

loans.name: Muslem

texts.en:
Muslem is an Iraqi youth client who is 26 years old and married with a single child. Muslem is the only provider in the family.

Muslem runs a shop where he sells all types of supplies like pencils, pens, books and calculators. He also sells magazines and newspapers. He established his business in 2011 and has developed good experience in this field. Muslem has a good reputation in his neighborhood and has gained his customers' respect.

Muslem is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to pay the annual rent of his shop. In the future, he hopes to expand his shop so that he may be able to educate his child and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien was born in 1966. She has two children. Her son is a student at the university. Her daughter is a worker. Her husband is a construction worker and earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Lien raises chickens and grows rice to earn a living. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 26 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

Lien has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She wants to use her profit to buy more baby chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en: Merlie is 32 years old and is blessed with two children. She established a sari-sari store where she sells daily commodities to the villagers. This has been a great help to her family. Merlie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy eggs, vinegar, sweets, biscuits, cooking oil and sugar to sell in her store. She would like to stock more items in her store to satisfy her customers' demand. She hopes to expand her sales and profits with the loan, to make her family economically secure and prepare for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy eggs, vinegar, sweets, biscuits, cooking oil and sugar to stock her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a 57-year-old married mother of six grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. Victoriana has been engaged in a crab fishing business with her family for more than 10 years as the sole source of their income.
Victoriana is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for storage. With this, Victoriana and her family will be able to improve their catch thus allowing them to sell more to the market. 
In the future, Victoriana hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for storage

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the ingredients needed in her food stall business which she has operated for 12 years now. She and her husband, who is a driver, work hard to provide income for their everyday needs and expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sarah dreams to expand her business and have a grocery store. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is 58 years old. She lives with her family in the village of Centro 2, San Guillermo. To support her family, Ellen is engaged in manicure and pedicure services. She has been in this business for five years. Right now, Ellen is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy supplies she needs in her business such as nail brushes, cuticle remover, and nail cutters. She dreams to have her own stall.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed in her manicure-pedicure business

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en: Adelia is a responsible mother who supports her husband in generating income. She is 40 years old and has three school-age children. She engages in the buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the market while her husband cultivates their farm land. They aim to improve their standard of living and increase their income in order to continue sending their children to school. Due to financial difficulty, Adelia is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of eggplants, bitter melon, okra, tomatoes, cabbages, beans, onions, garlic and carrots to sell. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of eggplants, bitter melon, okra, tomatoes, cabbages, beans, onions, garlic and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Yilton Alexander

texts.es: Yilton, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Ilama, Santa Bárbara.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 15 años de producir café y banano. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la comunidad o  sus alrededores. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras con el fin de darle mantenimiento a su finca, comprara fertilizantes, apodar y limpieza. Con esta inversión espera mejorar la plantación y la producción. Su plan es sembrar mas plantas para ampliar la producción y mantener siempre un buen producto para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yilton is 35 years old, single, and lives with his family in a neighborhood in the town of Ilama, Santa Bárbara. He has always been a farmer, producing coffee and bananas for the past 15 years. What he produces is sold at the local market in his community and in the surrounding areas.

Yilton decided to request a loan of 10,000 HNL so that he can his keep his farm well-maintained. He will buy fertilizers and pay for pruning and weeding. With this investment, he hopes to improve his planting and production. His plan is to sow more plants so that he can expand his production. This will allow him to always provide good products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for pruning and weeding.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 34 years old. She lives in Gurjaani District with her husband and two sons. Khatuna requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is her husband’s small salary working as guide. Khatuna has hens and she sells eggs locally. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Khatuna requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. With the received credit, Khatuna will purchase chicks, raise then and resell at higher prices. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and resell

loans.name: Piling Subur Group

texts.en:
Most of the nine members of the Piling Subur group have a trading business and raise livestock. One raises pigs. The group received a new loan of 22,500,000 IDR. 

Ni Ketut, the head of the group, will use a loan to buy four types of local pigs. The piglets will be raised for two months and then resold. Profits from the sale will be saved, and the capital will be used to buy another pig. Ni Ketut hopes that this effort will be smooth so that she can realize her dream of improving her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 19 years old and married. 
Salam owns a small cafeteria, where he offers to fast food and drinks. Ever since he was a child, Salam has worked as a waiter in a restaurant. After gaining enough experience, Salam decided to rely on himself and open his own business. In 2010, Salam successfully established his own restaurant and is gradually developing a good reputation in his surrounding area.
Salam is requesting a youth loan of $1,200 to renovate his cafeteria. In the future, Salam aims to grow his business even more, so he will be able to provide his family better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his cafeteria.

loans.name: Joice Sunday

texts.en:
Joice Sunday is a 45-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has six children between the ages of five and 20. All of them go to school.

Joice Sunday runs a store, and has been in business for seven years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 ssp to purchase beans, onions, and other items. She has no other source of income.

In five years Joice Sunday would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include the high prices in the market. Joice Sunday says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like beans, onions, etc.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung was born in 1949. She has a daughter who has her own family. Nhung means wisdom. She makes paper bags to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 3,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle Nhung borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy supplies and paper to make bags.

loans.use: to buy supplies and paper to make bags.

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
This is Delsa, 52, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Federico; they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Delsa operates the buying and selling business of her family. What she basically does is to buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell it at a little profit. Her products are clothes, slippers, shorts, towels, bed sheets and other similar products. Customers are attracted by the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy RTW products and items like polo shirts, socks and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Delsa dreams to expand her business and hopes that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different products like clothes, slippers, shorts, towels, bed sheets and other products for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old youth client from Iraq, who is married and a father of two children. Ali is the sole provider for the family.
Ali owns a small garage and specializes in repairing all type of cars. He established his business in 2005 and gained his long experience through working with his father, who ran a similar business. Now, Ali has become a well-known figure in his area since he is the only mechanic in the neighborhood.
Ali is requesting a $2,400 youth loan so that he may be able to pay the annual rent of his garage. In the future, Ali aims to continue growing and expanding his business so that one day, his children may work in the same field after they finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his garage

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is in the transportation business, particularly jeepney. She is indeed thankful because her husband is supportive of her running her transportation and other businesses. Marissa's husband is a driver and a farmer within her area. The couple also raises hogs as an additional source of income.

Marissa would like to change the wheels and buy gasoline for her jeepney to ensure the safety of her passengers. But due to insufficient capital, she is seeking a loan of PHP 10,000. She knows that this amount will enable her to obtain better income and secure her passengers. Marissa hopes and prays that she can obtain her loan to be able to secure her family's future, educate her three children and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and gasoline for her jeepney bus.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a married woman, 50 years old, from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 29 and the youngest is 15 years old. Eleuteria engages in a pottery-making business. She has been in this business for ten years now. Her monthly income is PHP 8,000. This is the source of her income.

Eleuteria is requesting a loan for additional capital for her business. By the help of this loan, she will  be able to buy what she needs for her business and to supplement the other needs of the family. In the future, Eleuteria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: additional capital for her pottery-making business.
